finding: The SNP rs4840542 showed significant association and has been linked to several traits, including BMI and neuroticism, marking its contribution to impulsivity.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: The SNP rs7829975 was identified to be significantly associated with multiple traits, further establishing its possible link to impulsivity.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: The SNP rs10956488 was linked to the GSDMC gene with high confidence (PP=0.962). Although GSDMC is poorly characterized, it is expressed in epithelial cells within enlarged hemorrhoidal tissue, suggesting a possible but unclear role in the disease's etiology.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 944,133 individuals provides insights into the etiology of hemorrhoidal disease

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with the RSTR phenotype, showing that the adjusted odds of being RSTR increased by 1.63 times for each copy of the minor allele (C) at this locus (p=0.04). It was identified as a Mtb-dependent eQTL associated with altered expression of CPSF1.
title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis-dependent Monocyte Expression Quantitative Trait Loci and Tuberculosis Pathogenesis

finding: The SNP rs13254191 was recognized as a causal SNP with an effect size of 0.03 in the simulated data-based GWAS study.
title: A High-resolution Haplotype-resolved Reference Panel Constructed from the China Kadoorie Biobank Study

finding: The SNP rs72725854 in the 8q24.21 region was linked to a decreased risk of multiple cancers (OR=0.28, P=4.7×10^-8) and maintained this association in analyses of invasive cancers, showcasing a strong protective effect.
title: Unraveling the genetic landscape of susceptibility to multiple primary cancers

finding: The SNP rs283732 was associated with a decreased risk of multiple invasive cancers (OR=0.90, P=1.1×10^-8), demonstrating its potential protective role.
title: Unraveling the genetic landscape of susceptibility to multiple primary cancers

finding: Identified as a sentinel variant, rs78597169 showed associations with short-term varenicline effectiveness, contributing to understanding individual responses to this cessation aid.
title: Genome-wide association study of varenicline-aided smoking cessation

finding: This SNP associated with FGFR1 related to lower FEV1/FVC and higher testosterone levels, highlighting its role in lung function and hormonal associations.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: rs541421523 was identified as positively associated with episodic memory decline and was located within neuron, oligodendrocyte, and astrocyte-specific regulatory elements, although specific mechanistic details were not provided.
title: Rare genetic coding variants associated with age-related episodic memory decline implicate distinct memory pathologies in the hippocampus

finding: Enriched in African ancestry, this variant correlated with higher HbA1c and fasting glucose levels, indicating a potential mechanism contributing to T2D susceptibility.
title: Rare variant association analysis in 51,256 type 2 diabetes cases and 370,487 controls informs the spectrum of pathogenicity of monogenic diabetes genes

finding: The female-specific SNP rs12542037 on chromosome 8 was significant for CRF-slope, with evidence of effect size differences between sexes, indicating it was only associated with females and showed significant heterogeneity.
title: The genetic case for cardiorespiratory fitness as a clinical vital sign and the routine prescription of physical activity in healthcare

finding: The SNP rs2678333 was identified as a GR-meQTL located on chromosome 12, demonstrating a post-dexamethasone-specific effect with a false discovery rate (FDR) of 8.24×10^-15. This finding indicated a significant association with methylation levels following glucocorticoid activation.
title: Multi-omics analysis of the molecular response to glucocorticoids - insights into shared genetic risk from psychiatric to medical disorders

finding: The SNP rs10096633 was located in the LPL region on chromosome 8, showing a significant association with triglyceride levels with a p-value of 3.24 × 10^-9 and a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 9.7%. Like rs1260326, it was crucial for the subsequent analysis of phase 2 subsamples.
title: Two-phase sample selection strategies for design and analysis in post-genome wide association fine-mapping studies

finding: Identified on chromosome 8q13.1, rs6992333 was associated with both bipolar disorder and brain structural features, including links to cortical surface and white matter microstructure. This SNP was also noted for its relevance in mania.
title: Isolating the genetic component of mania in bipolar disorder

finding: The SNP rs10503253 in the CSMD1 gene was associated with schizophrenia risk and had documented neuropsychological effects. Two studies, one by Donohoe et al. (2013) and another by Koiliari et al. (2014), reported that this variant impacted cognitive ability and executive function in healthy males, indicating its relevance to cognitive and psychiatric phenotypes.
title: Exome Sequencing of 963 Chinese Families Identifies Novel Epilepsy Candidate Genes

finding: The rs11778922 variant displayed female-specific effects, associating with weight change and previously showing nominal association with BMI in females.
title: The genetic architecture of changes in adiposity during adulthood

finding: SNP rs13281992 was previously reported to be genome-wide significant for heel bone mineral density (BMD), contributing to fracture risk with associations noted between 35,192 cases and 317,599 controls.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: SNP rs10958404 was involved in loci related to both head BMD and IA, indicating its dual relevance in skeletal and vascular genetics.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The variant rs1160267 in NKX3-1 at 8p21.2 showed significant association with PSA levels, further solidifying its importance established in previous genetic studies of prostate cancer.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: In the studies conducted by Roussotte et al, carrying the C allele at the rs11136000 locus within the CLU gene was determined to be significantly associated with total ventricular volume expansion and its surface morphology in Alzheimer's Disease patients. This locus was identified as the third strongest genetic risk factor for late onset Alzheimer's disease, following APOE ε4 and the rarer TREM2 variant. The findings highlighted the importance of combining CLU data with study designs focusing on brain changes.
title: Association of MRI-measured cerebral ventricular volume with APOE ε4 genotype, cerebrospinal fluid biomarkers (Aβ42 and Tau) and neuropsychological measures in Alzheimer’s disease: A Systematic Review

finding: SNP rs6395 was associated with splicing of CYP11B1 at the 8q24.3 locus. This locus was implicated in supporting the increased testosterone levels in women, further linking it to endometrial cancer risk, similar to the findings with rs1139380031.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study identifies novel endometrial cancer risk loci that are associated with obesity or female testosterone levels

finding: The SNP rs145657341 was tied to hyperlipidemia, with a risk difference (RD) of 0.14, significant in younger age groups.
title: Deleterious Variants Contribute Minimal Excess Risk in Large-Scale Testing

finding: The rs371282890 variant is noteworthy with a risk difference (RD) of 0.06, contributing to the predisposition of hyperlipidemia, particularly in younger individuals.
title: Deleterious Variants Contribute Minimal Excess Risk in Large-Scale Testing

finding: The SNP rs16885587 was associated with BFP in females, indicating its potential importance in sex-specific fat distribution.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs2912062, located near the genes ANGPT2 and AGPAT5, was shown to be associated with carotid intima-media thickness (IMT). The DeepPheWAS analysis recapitulated known GWAS findings and demonstrated the SNP's association with a phenotype not previously available in PheWAS platforms.
title: DeepPheWAS: an R package for phenotype generation and association analysis for phenome-wide association studies

finding: The variant rs9644568 in the intergenic region downstream of the LPL gene was significantly associated with high LDL-C levels among Filipinos. The G allele of rs9644568 conferred a 2.44-fold increased risk for high LDL-C in heterozygous individuals and a 10.66-fold increased risk in homozygous individuals. This finding was unique to the Filipino population, suggesting it might act as a risk marker independent of other components of metabolic syndrome like hypertension.
title: Variant rs9644568 in the intergenic region downstream of the LPL gene is associated with high LDL cholesterol levels among Filipinos

finding: The variant rs7016880, downstream of the LPL gene, was associated with LDL-C levels. Its characteristics of being located as a downstream non-coding regulator and having a possible multiplicative model of transmission provided greater confidence in the findings regarding high LDL-C.
title: Variant rs9644568 in the intergenic region downstream of the LPL gene is associated with high LDL cholesterol levels among Filipinos

finding: The SNP rs28513081, located in the DEPTOR gene on chromosome 8, was significantly associated with brain imaging-derived phenotypes (IDPs). It was linked to focal cortical thinning in the anterior cingulate and widespread changes in white matter microstructure, suggesting a direct effect related to DEPTOR expression. The association was confirmed to be significant with a high number of associations reaching the Bonferroni-corrected threshold, indicating strong relevance to IPF genetic risk.
title: Mapping brain endophenotypes associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis genetic risk

finding: The rs2958593 variant at the CSGALNACT1 locus was strongly associated with ASXL1-CH, providing an OR of 1.63 [1.38-1.91] and a P-value of 3.63 x 10^-8, establishing its relevance as a novel risk locus.
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: Mapping near CHRNA2 and EPHX2, this SNP was previously reported in association with cannabis use disorder, reaffirming its relevancy.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The SNP rs372262693, mapped to TG,SLA, showed interaction with LTST for PP in Hispanic populations, with a noted P-value of 2.3×10^-9, highlighting its importance in hypertension studies.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The SNP rs112585366 was included in the MDD PA-FGRS GWAS, identified as significant with a beta of 0.026 and a p-value of 4.4 × 10−8. This finding supported earlier genetic contributions to the clinical heterogeneity of MDD.
title: PA-FGRS is a novel estimator of pedigree-based genetic liability that complements genotype-based inferences into the genetic architecture of major depressive disorder

finding: This SNP, labeled rs591323 and associated with LOC105379297, was found to be one of the top 20 predictive SNPs for 'fast' progression of PD, with the non-reference allele raising the risk.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The rs34173062 variant in the SHARPIN gene was associated with longevity and previously associated with respiratory system diseases.
title: The effect of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants on longevity

finding: The rs34674752 variant in the SHARPIN gene was among the top effect sizes related to longevity.
title: The effect of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants on longevity

finding: This SNP showed a genome-wide significant association with longitudinal MMSE scores, yielding a P value of 1.89E-08. It is located in an intergenic region near TNKS, a gene that encodes tankyrase, which has roles in cell signaling and telomere regulation.
title: Genome-wide association study of Alzheimer’s disease brain imaging biomarkers and neuropsychological phenotypes in the EMIF-AD Multimodal Biomarker Discovery dataset

finding: The SNP rs10090297 was associated with the p53 pathway in glioblastoma, as referenced in the study by Zhang et al. (2018). This association provided insights into the mechanisms of response and resistance observed during the navtemadlin treatment in recurrent glioblastoma. The investigation highlighted that the absence of TP53-inactivating mutations in tumors indicated alternative mechanisms of resistance, thereby emphasizing the relevance of this SNP in understanding the genetic landscape of glioblastoma.
title: Surgical window of opportunity trial reveals mechanisms of response and resistance to navtemadlin (KRT-232) in patients with recurrent glioblastoma

finding: The SNP rs13250010 was classified as G0-specific, indicating its role in the structural composition of IgG glycans as they transition to more complex glycosylation.
title: Mapping of the gene network that regulates glycan clock of ageing

finding: This SNP was also a shared locus between hypothyroidism and TSH levels, exemplifying the interrelated genetic basis of thyroid function.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The SNP rs12542037 at the XKR6/8p23.1 locus was associated with endometriosis and is in strong linkage disequilibrium with SNPs linked to both osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis. It was noted as an original finding, regulating genes involved in innate and adaptive immune system pathways, and it revealed intersections in genetic risk variants among the investigated conditions.
title: The Association between Endometriosis and Immunological diseases

finding: The ADRA1A rs1048101 variant was associated with an increased risk of CKD in AA homozygotes (HR 1.18, 95% CI 1.04 to 1.34, p=0.01) compared to GG homozygotes. The findings suggested that patient management could potentially improve by considering this genotype.
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: The SNP in SLC30A8 (rs3802177) was associated with early type 2 diabetes (T2D) diagnosis. It significantly influenced T2D development in males diagnosed early with an R² sum of 23.5%.
title: Sex-specific genetic loci linked to early and late onset type 2 diabetes

finding: The KHDRBS3 SNP (rs6577691) was associated exclusively with early T2D diagnosis, contributing to the genetic risk profile for T2D in individuals diagnosed at or before age 45.
title: Sex-specific genetic loci linked to early and late onset type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs819185 at STC1 indicated significant interactions with thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) levels, with a P-value of P=0.00177. The analysis suggested that the effect of this SNP on eGFRcrea was larger at lower TSH levels, aligning with the hypothesis of stanniocalcin-1 mediating such effects.
title: Systematic mediation and interaction analyses of kidney function genetic loci in a general population study

finding: Similar to rs819185, SNP rs819196 at STC1 showed significant interaction with TSH levels, having a P-value of P=0.00154. The results indicated that higher effects on eGFRcrea were observed at lower TSH levels, reinforcing a consistent pattern in the analysis regarding TSH as an effect modifier.
title: Systematic mediation and interaction analyses of kidney function genetic loci in a general population study

finding: The SNP rs2950922 in the UNC5D region on chromosome 8 was found to be significantly associated with rare functional variants in the EBV BALF5 gene. It acted as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for UNC5D in esophageal tissue, suggesting a link between host genomic variation and viral DNA replication during late lytic infection.
title: The influence of human genetic variation on Epstein-Barr virus sequence diversity

finding: The rs1801280 SNP, a variant in the NAT2 gene related to isoniazid metabolism, was categorized under the slow acetylator genotype due to being homozygous for the variant allele or heterozygous at multiple loci. This genotype predominated among participants experiencing TB-ADR, indicating its significant role in increasing susceptibility to drug-related adverse reactions during tuberculosis treatment.
title: Prediction models for adverse drug reactions during tuberculosis treatment in Brazil

finding: Similar to rs1801280, the rs1799930 SNP in the NAT2 gene was also associated with slower acetylation profiles among participants. Being categorized as a slow acetylator was linked to an increased risk of TB-ADR, highlighting the importance of this genetic variant in the metabolism of isoniazid.
title: Prediction models for adverse drug reactions during tuberculosis treatment in Brazil

finding: The rs1799931 SNP, another variant in the NAT2 gene, contributed to the slow acetylator phenotype. Participants with this genotype exhibited a higher incidence of TB-ADRs, emphasizing its relevance in isoniazid metabolism and treatment outcomes in tuberculosis.
title: Prediction models for adverse drug reactions during tuberculosis treatment in Brazil

finding: The findings related to rs1801279 indicated that it too belonged to the NAT2 locus impacting isoniazid metabolism. Its association with the slow acetylator status contributed to the overall risk of adverse drug reactions, providing further support for the need to consider NAT2 genotyping in clinical settings.
title: Prediction models for adverse drug reactions during tuberculosis treatment in Brazil

finding: The SNP rs7000397 was identified as a lead variant for the gene NRG1 in the GWAS analyzing log thyroid volume. This finding correlated with known associations and was considered a significant result with respect to thyroid traits.
title: Removing array-specific batch effects in GWAS mega-analyses by applying a two-step imputation workflow reveals new associations for thyroid volume and goiter

finding: The SNP rs112518363, found near the INTS10 gene, became significantly associated with tau pathology when adjusted for APOE-ε4 status, showing a p-value of 3.51×10^-8, indicating its importance in tau related audiences.
title: Genome-wide scan of Flortaucipir PET levels finds JARID2 associated with cerebral tau deposition

finding: The minor C-allele of SNP rs13273708 was shown to be associated with decreased DNA methylation levels at the LY6E gene but only in SS patients. This significant interaction suggests a disease-specific epigenetic effect.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: The minor A-allele of SNP rs902834 decreased DNA methylation levels at the STAT1 gene only in SS patients. This association signifies its role in the disease's molecular landscape.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: The variant rs183373024, a non-coding variant near the POU5F1B gene, contributed 0.54 attributable DALYs, primarily associated with prostate cancer, indicating its relevance to disease burden.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: Variant rs35006907 was associated with left ventricular function indicators and overlapped an enhancer regulating MTSS1 in all VCMs, which is lethal upon knockout, suggesting its critical role in myocardial development.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: The rs12334416 variant was located in the PINX1 gene, with credible set overlaps including genes linked to developmental delays. This association indicated a potential mechanism linking PINX1's dysfunction to miscarriage.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: The rs2920991 variant replicated at the Bonferroni-corrected level in a recent pregnancy loss GWAS. This variant was associated with PRAG1, an enzyme in the tyrosine kinase family, linking genetic predisposition to miscarriage.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: Associated with decreased mutation count specifically in males, rs117344298 correlated with MSRA, indicating a nuanced role in the landscape of clonal hematopoiesis.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: The SNP rs4841132 found in the gene PPP1R3B was noted for its relationship to liver disease risk, particularly in modulating glucagon sensitivity.
title: Studies to develop a glucagon sensitivity test in humans: The GLUSENTIC study protocol

finding: The SNP rs2978977 was similarly identified as genome-wide significant in the gastric cancer analysis using the TAPE and TAPE-LTFH methods. It was previously documented in association with gastric cancer in Chinese and Japanese populations, marking this study as its inaugural recognition in relation to gastric cancer among Korean individuals.
title: Incorporating family disease history and controlling case-control imbalance for population based genetic association studies

finding: SNP rs17776622, located within the core consensus binding motif of YY1, significantly influenced the expression of SOX7 eRNA (SOX7e), illustrating its potential impact on transcription regulation.
title: Enhancer RNA transcriptome-wide association study reveals an atlas of pan-cancer susceptibility eRNAs

finding: This genetic variant was associated with an increased risk of breast cancer and correlated with higher expression of ZNF703 eRNA (ZNF703e), a known oncogene in luminal B breast cancer.
title: Enhancer RNA transcriptome-wide association study reveals an atlas of pan-cancer susceptibility eRNAs

finding: The SNP, rs530542541, found on the ANK1 gene, was significant in association with SB and AUD, with a p-value of 3.63E-08, indicating its potential relevance in the context of suicidal behaviors and alcohol use disorders.
title: Genetic Factors Associated with Suicidal Behaviors and Alcohol Use Disorders in an American Indian Population

finding: The SNP rs9643846 was noted as significant, with a p-value of 6.57E-07, located within the intron of the ZMAT4 gene. Its role was linked to potential implications in Kawasaki disease (KD) pathology.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: Showed association for any PIK3CA mutation with P value 0.026 in AFA women.
title: Association of ESR1 germline variants with TP53 somatic variants in breast tumors in a genome-wide study

finding: The rs6998061 variant in the POU5F1B gene was replicated in the prostate cancer-specific analysis with an odds ratio of 1.23, indicating its association with multiple tumor types.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: The rs191064896 variant in the ADGRB1 gene was associated with a high odds ratio of 108.36 for carrying individuals who had both a lymphoid neoplasm and prostate cancer.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: The findings indicated that rs2279590 was included as a proxy for rs9331896, which is associated with the gene CLU. The genetic risk score incorporating this SNP showed strong positive associations with LDL cholesterol and other lipid-related traits, suggesting its role in influencing lipid metabolism related to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Effects of genetic liability to Alzheimer’s disease on circulating metabolites across the life course

finding: The SNP rs73293634 showed significant association with impulsivity in juvenile myoclonic epilepsy (JME), achieving a p-value of 7.5 x 10^-9. It was located near the gene SLCO5A1, which is implicated in synapse assembly. The minor allele (T) for this SNP decreased SLCO5A1 expression in the cerebral cortex, with a phenotypic variance explained (PVE) of 10.1% in the European cohort.
title: SLCO5A1 and synaptic assembly genes contribute to impulsivity in juvenile myoclonic epilepsy

finding: The SNP rs2928617 was uniquely identified by Funmap as the causal SNP in the analysis of triglyceride concentration (TC) due to its extremely high PIP of 1. This finding showcased the effectiveness of Funmap in correctly prioritizing causal variants by integrating functional annotations.
title: Funmap: integrating high-dimensional functional annotations to improve fine-mapping

finding: Identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the DPY19L4 gene, rs6471480 demonstrated significant findings in the context of adipose tissue and ventricular heart conditions.
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs920590 in the INTS10 gene was associated with insulin resistance (IR). Individuals carrying the T/T genotype exhibited a significantly increased risk of IR compared to those with C/C-C/T genotypes, with an odds ratio of 4.01 and 95% confidence interval of 1.55-10.34 (p < 0.0014). This finding was established under a recessive model.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Insulin Resistance Risk in Normal BMI Indians

finding: The SNP rs61740399 was identified as a novel locus for anxiety (ANX), which was linked to YTHDF3. This locus was found to be within an exonic region.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: This SNP was significantly correlated with tobacco use disorder through its association with the CHRNA2 gene, which is relevant in smoking behavior.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The rare variant rs552968665 in ADCK5 was linked to glycocholenate sulfate levels, suggesting its potential impact in bile acid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs2242090 linked to PYCR3 was associated with S-1-pyrroline-5-carboxylate levels, revealing its role in proline metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs62516550 was associated with rIA, with a p-value of 2.94×10^−11 and an odds ratio of 1.20. This SNP was identified through the GWAS as part of the significant loci related to the risk of rIA.
title: Integrative genomics analysis implicates decreased FGD6 expression underlying risk of intracranial aneurysm rupture

finding: The SNP rs17057051 was found in strong linkage disequilibrium with the top IBD variant and was located in an intron of the PTK2B gene. PTK2B has been implicated in the risk of late-onset Alzheimer's disease and has shown significant roles in monocyte migration and neutrophil degranulation.
title: Genetic insights into the association between inflammatory bowel disease and Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs73223431 was identified as an LD proxy for AD risk loci, located within the same intron of the PTK2B gene as rs17057051. PTK2B has been established as a key gene associated with Alzheimer's disease and has an eQTL in monocytes, suggesting its importance in the context of myeloid cell function.
title: Genetic insights into the association between inflammatory bowel disease and Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs28834970, also found in the intron of the PTK2B gene, was similarly identified as an LD proxy linked to AD susceptibility loci. This indicates that PTK2B's involvement extends to both IBD and AD, highlighting its role in processes affecting myeloid cells in the immune response.
title: Genetic insights into the association between inflammatory bowel disease and Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs35246381 near NAT2 was linked to insulin resistance and increased TRL remnants, showing its prospective utility as a marker for metabolic complications and lipid dysregulation.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: The rs16872808 SNP in the ZFPM2 locus was significantly associated with reduced difficulty awakening after conditioning on chronotype, demonstrating a beta conditional of -0.01 (p = 5.44×10^{-9}) and was also significantly associated with evening chronotype after conditioning on difficulty awakening (beta conditional = 0.04, p = 1.12×10^{-8}). In marginal analysis, it showed only nominal associations with reduced difficulty awakening (beta marginal = -0.005, p = 0.0010) and evening chronotype (beta marginal = 0.022, p = 0.0004).
title: Sleep inertia drives the association of evening chronotype with psychiatric disorders: epidemiological and genetic evidence

finding: In the rs685985 locus, significant interactions were observed between SSc GWAS SNPs and the CHD7 gene in CD4+ T cells. CHD7 is noted as a chromatin remodeler linked to lymphocyte counts, supporting its role in SSc.
title: Functional genomics in primary T cells and monocytes identifies mechanisms by which genetic susceptibility loci influence systemic sclerosis risk

finding: The SNP rs2976562 showed a significant association with SLAP-1 (SLA) expression in Mtb-stimulated monocyte-derived macrophages (p=0.03). The T allele was correlated with lower SLA expression after stimulation, while it was associated with higher SLA levels prior to stimulation. This upregulation change related to TB severity, where T/T homozygotes displayed more severe disease.
title: Tuberculosis severity associates with variants and eQTLs related to vascular biology and infection-induced inflammation

finding: The SNP rs13266634, a missense variant located in the SLC30A8 gene, was significantly associated with GDM susceptibility, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.29 and a p-value of 1.83×10^-10.
title: Genome-wide association and Mendelian randomisation analysis among 30,699 Chinese pregnant women identifies novel genetic and molecular risk factors for gestational diabetes and glycaemic traits

finding: The variant rs61578937 was mentioned as being associated with time to irreversible EDSS milestones, although specific statistical data was not detailed.
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: In females, rs9643199, intronic to MTSS1, was significantly associated with time to irreversible EDSS 3 and 6, showing adjusted hazard ratios of 1.35 (p=0.006) for irEDSS3 and 1.46 (p=7.09×10^-4) for irEDSS6.
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: The SNP rs1532278 was identified as a neuron-specific functional AD-associated variant. It was revealed that the AD protective T allele of rs1532278 elevates neuronal CLU expression and enhances neuron excitability through a cascade of biological processes including neuron-to-glia lipid transfer and the accumulation of lipid droplets in astrocytes.
title: Alzheimer’s disease protective allele of Clusterin modulates neuronal excitability through lipid-droplet-mediated neuron-glia communication

finding: The intronic variant in CDCA2 showed a significant association with VAT adjusted for BMI (VATadjBMI) (P = 1.3 x 10^-29), linking it to waist-to-hip ratio adjusted for BMI (WHRadjBMI) and serum triglycerides.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The SNP rs612558 was shown to have significant allelic imbalance linked to the action of <italic>RAB2A</italic>. It was correlated with increased transcription and functional changes in the genomic interaction landscape at the locus.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: In this study, rs686852 along with rs612558 demonstrated significant allelic imbalance effects within the <italic>RAB2A-CHD7</italic> region, contributing to altered chromatin states and downstream regulatory impacts.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs7010016 was linked to the development of a handheld enzymatic luminescent biosensor for the rapid detection of heavy metals in water samples. This research indicated its utility in biosensor technology for environmental monitoring.
title: A handheld luminometer with sub-attomole limit of detection for distributed applications in global health

finding: Within the 8p23.1 locus, rs2979256 was involved in the fractional anisotropy (FA) of the inferior fronto-occipital fasciculus, highlighting its significance in understanding sleep-related imaging traits.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP in the 8p23.1 region indicated links between chronotype and cardiac MRI traits.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs2942194, located within SLC25A37, was found to be a risk variant linked to PAU in the cross-ancestry analysis, contributing to the broader understanding of genetic factors impacting substance use.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The SNP rs2272736 in the IKBKB gene was found to be associated with gastric cancer survival. This finding was significant in the context of gastric cancer patients, indicating a potential genetic factor influencing their survival outcomes.
title: Loss of heterozygosity in gastric cancers in a set of Mexican patients

finding: An eQTL for ZBTB10, this SNP lies in an lncRNA and relates to cytokine regulation, thereby influencing immune responses.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: The rs147261056 variant, mapped to the ASPH and CLVS1 genes, interacted with long total sleep time (LTST) in its association with triglycerides (TG), indicating its relevance in lipid metabolism influenced by sleep duration.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The rs114083565 variant, mapping to the RUNX1 gene, showed association with TG levels connected to short total sleep time (STST), highlighting its impact on lipid disorders influenced by sleep.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: This SNP was recognized as a shared signal between several fatty acid traits, indicating its importance in the genetic correlations observed.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Shown to be a missense mutation within the DOK2 gene and categorized as benign, this SNP was linked to pathways relevant to atopic dermatitis.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: The SNP rs11787077 located near the CLU gene was also replicated, showing nominal significance (P=0.009), which indicates its established association with AD risk.
title: A genome-wide association study in Peruvians suggests new risk loci for Alzheimer Disease

finding: The SNP rs2736345 at locus 8p23.1 in the BLK gene was associated with SLE with a P-value of 1.5×10^-25, marking it as a significant finding across European and Chinese populations.
title: Genome-wide Association Clustering Meta-analysis in European and Chinese Datasets for Systemic Lupus Erythematosus identifies new genes

finding: SNP rs28834970 was correlated with PTK2B and significantly associated with AD risk, providing an important link between immune response and AD pathology.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: SNP rs6557994 was identified as the most significant eSNP for PTK2B and showed a moderate correlation with a GWAS SNP associated with AD, indicating its role in risk pathways.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: The study identified the BIN3 rs2280104 T allele as being associated with excessive daytime sleepiness (EDS) in Parkinson's disease (PD) patients. It was also found that the direct connectivity (DC) of the left calcarine area in the structural network mediated the effects of this SNP on both EDS scores and cognitive function, as assessed through Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) scores.
title: Structural network topology mediated cognitive impairment in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs2738058 demonstrated very strong evidence for association with periodontitis, and in the analysis, it was associated with increased colorectal cancer risk, having a significant p-value in this context.
title: Two-sample Mendelian randomization analysis of associations between periodontal disease and risk of colorectal, lung, and pancreatic cancers

finding: The variant rs60103302, located near the SNTG1 gene, was identified as a significant rare variant associated with hip bone mineral density (BMD) with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.0092 and a p-value of 1.67×10−7. This association was not previously reported and could only be detected using the SEAD panel. It was also noted that this variant's significance in mitigating the proliferation and differentiation of preosteoblasts was demonstrated through in-vitro assays.
title: SEAD: an augmented reference panel with 22,134 haplotypes boosts the rare variants imputation and GWAS analysis in Asian population

finding: The intronic SNP rs111829635 was evaluated using dual-luciferase assays, where it was found that the C-T mutation significantly increased luciferase activity in both 293T and MC3T3-E1 cell lines. This finding suggested that this SNP could alter the transcriptional activity of the SNTG1 gene.
title: SEAD: an augmented reference panel with 22,134 haplotypes boosts the rare variants imputation and GWAS analysis in Asian population

finding: The SNP rs56372821, located near the CHRNA2 gene, was reported in the GWAS of cannabis use disorder (CUD). It indicated significance in the context of CUD, suggesting a potential convergence in the cholinergic system and nicotinic receptors that could play a role in the underlying etiology of CUD. The association with other smoking traits was also highlighted, as 20 out of 22 original lead SNPs associated with smoking behaviors, such as smoking initiation and heaviness, remained genome-wide significant in analyses that conditioned on these traits.
title: Examining the independent roles of cannabis use and tobacco use in depression risk: a multivariable Mendelian randomisation study

finding: SNP rs11992999 was recognized for its association near the HAS2 gene, which encodes hyaluronic synthetase. This enzyme produces hyaluronic acid, a mucopolysaccharide known to influence vascular smooth muscle cell (VSMC) proliferation and the mechanical properties of tissues. This SNP was significantly associated with aortic distensibility.
title: The Genetic Determinants of Aortic Distension

finding: The SNP rs6983263 was identified at locus 8q22.1 as an intronic variant of LAPTM4B, showing an association with IPF (OR[95%CI]=0.92[0.9, 0.95], P=4.47×10^-8), contributing to novel insights about genetic factors influencing IPF.
title: Common and rare variant analyses reveal novel genetic factors underlying Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis and shared aetiology with COVID-19

finding: The non-coding SNP rs72725854 (A>T) at the 8q24 locus was associated with approximately a 2-fold increased risk of prostate cancer (PrCa) in men of African ancestry (AA). The alternate allele 'T' introduced a binding site for the transcription factor SPDEF, which significantly increased the activity of the associated enhancer and led to higher expression of target genes PCAT1, PVT1, and c-Myc in response to androgen stimulation, amplifying the risk for PrCa.
title: Non-coding genetic variants underlying higher prostate cancer risk in men of African ancestry

finding: The common SNP rs10095018 (T/C) was identified as a lost activity eSNP, significantly reducing enhancer activity as per the model (EWN=10). This SNP is located near the NDRG1 gene, which plays a role in suppressing prostate cancer; the alternate allele 'C' diminished FOXA1 binding, resulting in lower NDRG1 expression levels in the MDA PCa 2B cell line compared to LNCaP. This suggests that the 'C' allele may impact patient outcomes adversely by disrupting a key tumor suppressor function.
title: Non-coding genetic variants underlying higher prostate cancer risk in men of African ancestry

finding: The SNP rs4732724 was also identified as a genome-wide significant independent SNP connected to cannabis use disorder in the same GWAS analysis that involved a substantial number of participants from diverse ancestries. Like rs7783012, this indicates that rs4732724 is associated with the risk of developing cannabis use disorder.
title: Association between cannabis use and brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank: an observational and Mendelian randomization study

finding: The NAT2 rs1041983 polymorphism was associated with severe adverse drug reactions (ADRs) in the context of isoniazid treatment. In a study conducted in Taiwan, 22.8% of participants were identified as slow metabolizers of isoniazid, and the presence of this specific variant correlated significantly with increased severity of ADRs, particularly hepatotoxicity.
title: Clinical Predictors of 3-Months Isoniazid Rifapentine (3HP) - Related Adverse Drug Reactions (ADR) During Tuberculosis Preventive Therapy. (PAnDoRA-3HP study): An Observational Study Protocol

finding: With low frequency in Indians, the rs1532423 variant was associated with reduced zinc levels, suggesting potential implications for lower susceptibility to COVID-19.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: rs4523233 was identified as the likely causal variant associated with increased levels of 11-deoxycortisol. The findings indicated that this SNP might correlate with enzyme expression in the adrenal gland, impacting overall cortisol production.
title: Steroid hormone levels vary with sex, aging, lifestyle, and genetics

finding: The cadmium decreasing variant rs6987313 was positively associated with phosphate and triglyceride levels.
title: New insights into the genetic etiology of 57 essential and non-essential trace elements in humans

finding: The variant rs3802177 in SLC30A8 showed significant association with colorectal cancer risk when interacting with diabetes, with a p-value of 5.46×10−11. The association indicated that this variant modified the relationship between diabetes and colorectal cancer risk, exhibiting strong evidence of diabetes association (p-value: 4.90×10−10) and interaction for colorectal cancer risk (p-value: 7.49×10−04). Stratification by genotype revealed the highest odds ratio (OR: 1.62 for AA) for diabetes among those with colorectal cancer.
title: Probing the diabetes and colorectal cancer relationship using gene – environment interaction analyses

finding: Identified in the GWAS for Duane retraction syndrome, rs7834393 (MAF=0.00374, p=3.1e-08, OR=47.331) indicated a high association near UBE2W, although its validity was questioned as a potential technical artifact.
title: Large-scale trans-ethnic replication and discovery of genetic associations for rare diseases with self-reported medical data

finding: The SNP rs4646249 was confirmed as being associated with coronary artery disease (CAD) and was among the 15 CAD variants that showed genome-wide significance (GWS) in relation to lipid species.

This SNP (rs894211) was listed among the CAD variants shown to be significantly associated with lipid species, reaffirming its role in the genetic architecture of lipid metabolism linked to cardiovascular diseases.

The SNP rs6473226 was identified in the 8q21.13 region, which was associated with asthma and hay fever in a study of European ancestry. This SNP was located between the genes MIR5708 and RNU6-1213P, with multiple studies confirming its association with asthma.
title: A powerful replicability analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The variant rs2976397 was associated with gastric ulcer, gastric cancer, and gastric polyp, showing an Odds Ratio (OR) of 0.86 and a p-value of 6.1×10^-24, indicating it was a significant finding related to these phenotypes.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: For rs4733781, a candidate SNP replicated in the multi-ancestry meta-analysis with a p-value of 3.22e-05, and was located in the ASAP1 gene. This gene has been consistently implicated in TB susceptibility across different studies.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of host genetic susceptibility to tuberculosis identifies shared genetic architecture

finding: Similar to rs4733781, the SNP rs10956514 also replicated in the meta-analysis, with a p-value of 0.000118, situated in the ASAP1 region, confirming its involvement in susceptibility to TB.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of host genetic susceptibility to tuberculosis identifies shared genetic architecture

finding: SNP rs79407615 at chromosome 8 was identified as the sentinel variant for a locus associated with ΔTHR. Carriers of the G allele had a significant reduction in ΔTHR (beta = -0.4123, p = 1.58e-9), indicating a protective role against the development of insulin resistance and type 2 diabetes.
title: Novel Loci (EIF4A2, ADIPOQ, TPRG1) for Triglyceride / High-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol Ratio Longitudinal Change (ΔTHR) among Subjects without Type 2 Diabetes: Evidence from the Long Life Family Study (LLFS) and the Framingham Heart Study (FHS) Offspring Cohort (OS)

finding: SNP rs58379124 mapped onto the CHRNB3 gene and was likewise connected to the genetic basis of cigarette use, forming part of the nicotinic pathway.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs1106634, located within ATP6V1B2, had previous associations with Major Depressive Disorder (p=7×10^-7) and bipolar disorder (p=5.63×10^-6), which links it to MDD.
title: Epigenome-wide association study of self-reported antidepressant use in Generation Scotland implicates the innate immune system

finding: This SNP was identified as having a co-localized eQTL with the NRG1 gene, linking it to inflammatory responses relevant to gout.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of 2,622,830 individuals reveals new pathogenic pathways in gout

finding: The intronic SNP rs4607615 was linked with expression of MSRA (p=0.026), RP1L1 (p=0.041), and showed the strongest association with PRSS51 (p=6.11×10^-7), even though it was located 61 kb downstream of PRSS51.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of Alzheimer disease reveals many differentially expressed genes and multiple biological pathways in brain tissue from African American donors

finding: The SNP rs16892766 located at 8q23.3 was nominally associated with CRC risk, reporting an OR of 1.52 (95% CI: 1.082-2.142, P=0.01). Despite being notable, it exhibited low frequency, which might have influenced the results.
title: Colorectal Cancer Risk and Ancestry in Colombian admixed Populations

finding: The SNP rs7014346 at 8q24.21 was negatively associated with the early onset of colorectal cancer (OR=0.42, CI: 0.27-0.65, p=0.000097), showing its relevance in genetic predisposition.
title: Colorectal Cancer Risk and Ancestry in Colombian admixed Populations

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with the mild progression subtype (Subtype I) of PD.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The SNP rs2920287 was identified as the only genome-wide significant hit for reaction time, with a p-value of 1.907e-08 in the analyzed data. Although this finding was significant, follow-up analyses using the GWAS Catalog did not show associations with any other traits. This suggests that while rs2920287 may relate to reaction time, further support for its association with other cognitive or psychiatric phenotypes was not found.
title: Positive and negative affect, related mental health traits, and cognitive performance: shared genetic architecture and potential causality

finding: The SNP rs12541595 was associated with LV MTSS1 expression and 20 of 82 cardiac magnetic resonance (CMR) traits in a study of 22,381 UK Biobank participants. The associations were primarily strong in females, indicating a genetic basis for sex dimorphism in cardiac remodeling.
title: Sex-Specific Effect of MTSS1 Downregulation on Dilated Cardiomyopathy

finding: The SNP rs35006907 also demonstrated significant associations with LV MTSS1 expression and various CMR traits, particularly in females, suggesting that this variant plays a role in the observed sex differences in cardiac traits and diseases related to MTSS1.
title: Sex-Specific Effect of MTSS1 Downregulation on Dilated Cardiomyopathy

finding: The SNP rs3899035 was connected to NCALD, a calcium sensor protein crucial for cellular signaling. This SNP was found to influence the expression of NCALD and other nearby genes, with implications for modifying spinal muscular atrophy disease progression.
title: Candidate gene modifiers of dystrophinopathy identified by the uniform application of genome-wide datasets to novel GWAS-identified loci

finding: The SNP rs11136000, located in the CLU gene, was associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) specifically in the Caucasian population. This finding highlighted the importance of genetic variations impacting the susceptibility to AD, emphasizing that such associations may not be consistent across different ethnic groups, as the same association was not found in the Chinese population.
title: Multi-transcriptomic analysis points to early organelle dysfunction in human astrocytes in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: This variant, identified as tagging the CLU locus, demonstrated a highly significant association with age at onset, p=5.5×10^-8, and replicated in three independent studies. The link to clusterin biology established its importance in Alzheimer's disease mechanisms.
title: Genetic Associations with Age at Dementia Onset in the PSEN1 E280A Colombian Kindred

finding: The genetic variant rs66886237 at 8p21.3 near the gene GFRA2 was found to be associated with the composite cardiovascular endpoint in 1029 heart failure patients with preserved ejection fraction from the CHARM-Preserved study. It exhibited a hazard ratio (HR) of 1.91 (95% confidence interval (CI): 1.55-2.35; P=1.7×10^-9). The effect remained significant after further adjustments for potential confounders.
title: Pharmacogenomic study of heart failure and candesartan response from the CHARM programme

finding: The SNP rs7018178 was included in the study to assess its role in measuring copy number alterations in the context of chromosomes 8q and was specifically used for evaluating allelic imbalances during SNP-based approaches.
title: Allele-specific digital PCR enhances precision and sensitivity in the detection and quantification of copy number alterations in heterogeneous DNA samples: an in silico and in vitro validation study

finding: The SNP rs7843014 was utilized in the context of digital PCR analysis to measure allelic imbalances, contributing to the assessment of copy number variants associated with chromosome 8q.
title: Allele-specific digital PCR enhances precision and sensitivity in the detection and quantification of copy number alterations in heterogeneous DNA samples: an in silico and in vitro validation study

finding: The SNP rs2919408 was validated for left-sided bone metastasis and was implicated as a risk allele. It demonstrated significant association in the context of the pooled GWAS and replication analyses, although it was part of a small study population that may influence the overall significance findings.
title: Functional annotation with expression validation identifies novel metastasis-relevant genes from post-GWAS risk loci in sporadic colorectal carcinomas

finding: The SNP rs1466526 was found to be associated with the sex-biased expression of the nearby gene ZC2HC1A, with a larger effect in females. It exhibited significant association with multiple sclerosis (MS) susceptibility, highlighting a fold-enrichment of 56.5 and an FDR of 4.54×10^-19, indicating a strong link to sex-biased autoimmune diseases.
title: Biological sex affects functional variation across the human genome

finding: The variant rs601558 on chromosome 8 was significantly associated with the left cerebellum cortex LBS (p=8.0E-11) and also served as a brain eQTL for RSPO2. This SNP was categorized as benign by ClinVar and AlphaMissense despite its high CADD score of 22.
title: Beyond Volume: Unraveling the Genetics of Human Brain Geometry

finding: The SNP rs755857 was identified as significant in GWAS analyses of the corpus callosum (CC) subregions, showing involvement in multiple regions except for the mid-posterior. It was associated with the gene PINX1, which has links to liver function as indicated by its association with gamma glutamyl transferase and serum alkaline phosphatase levels. This suggests that the genetic influences on CC volume may connect with liver function markers.
title: Distributed Genetic Effects of the Corpus Callosum Subregions Suggest Links to Neuropsychiatric Disorders and Related Traits

finding: This SNP was similarly linked to amino acid levels and was used as a proxy in the study.
title: Causal effects of maternal circulating amino acids on offspring birthweight: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The SNP rs11779558, located at the 8p21.3 locus, was significantly associated with eQTL functionality in the tibial artery, indicating its role in gene regulation related to cardiovascular health, particularly connected to the exportin 7 (XPO7) gene.
title: Contribution of leukocyte telomere length to major cardiovascular diseases onset: phenotypic and genetic insights from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: This SNP was also identified from East Asian samples, associating it with an increased risk of severe COVID-19, suggesting that it contributes to the progression of the disease rather than just susceptibility.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The study identified the FOG2 missense variant rs28374544 (A1969G, S657G) as significantly associated with coronary microvascular disease (CMVD) through phenome-wide association studies (PheWAS). Carriers of the S657G variant exhibited increased symptoms of chest pain, a smaller burden of obstructive coronary artery disease, and alterations in coronary blood flow. Additionally, the variant was shown to elevate the expression of genes linked to angiogenesis, glycolysis, and the hypoxia-inducible factor (HIF) pathway, suggesting a gain-of-function role for S657G in promoting angiogenic gene expression and angiogenesis. Notably, the study documented a 4.5% incidence of complex congenital heart disease (CHD) among patients with the GG genotype, reinforcing the variant's connection to cardiac pathologies.
title: FOG2 coding variant Ser657Gly is associated with Coronary Microvascular Disease through altered hypoxia-mediated gene transcription

finding: This SNP was associated with a deletion affecting the olfactory receptor family 4 subunit C member 6 (OR4C6) in lateral collateral ligament tissue. The study found that it was linked to decreased expression of the indoleamine 2,3-dioxygenase 1 (IDO1) gene in blood cells, a relevant finding given its role in immune modulation in the context of liver transplantation.
title: The impact of genome-wide histocompatibility on liver transplantation outcomes

finding: The SNP rs1045547 displayed an opposing effect on the risk of stomach cancer versus duodenal ulcer, identified as being under balancing selection.
title: Extensive antagonistic variants across human genome

finding: The SNP rs61732533 was associated with four nearby hub genes: MAF1 and BOP1 in excitatory neurons, and PLEC and CPSF1 in inhibitory neurons. The gene MAF1, a stress responsive transcription factor and mTOR effector, was prioritized in excitatory neurons, indicating its potential involvement in Alzheimer's Disease (AD) mechanisms.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: The SNP rs1065712 had the nearest hub gene CTSB in excitatory neurons, which was identified as the highest prioritized gene for this variant, contributing to its potential role in Alzheimer's Disease.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: The SNP rs1532278 indicated CLU as the hub gene, underscoring its relevance in the genetic landscape of Alzheimer's Disease.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: For SNP rs779805849, a variant within the ANK1 gene, weak evidence of replication was observed in T1D, with a significant finding (p-value=0.01) noted among fifteen available variants.
title: Whole-genome sequencing identifies variants in ANK1, LRRN1, HAS1, and other genes and regulatory regions for stroke in type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs146416859 showed replication evidence for hemorrhagic stroke in T1D, with a p-value less than 0.05 in the stroke subtype analysis.
title: Whole-genome sequencing identifies variants in ANK1, LRRN1, HAS1, and other genes and regulatory regions for stroke in type 1 diabetes

finding: Similar to rs146416859, the rs61753679 variant replicated for hemorrhagic stroke in T1D with a p-value under 0.05.
title: Whole-genome sequencing identifies variants in ANK1, LRRN1, HAS1, and other genes and regulatory regions for stroke in type 1 diabetes

finding: Part of the NAT2 genotypes, rs1801280 was included in categorizing slow acetylator status, which was associated with an increased risk of treatment-related grade 2 or greater adverse events, particularly hepatotoxicity.
title: Pharmacogenetics of tuberculosis treatment toxicity and effectiveness in a large Brazilian cohort

finding: This SNP was also part of the NAT2 genotyping, contributing to the classification of acetylator status linked to adverse treatment effects.
title: Pharmacogenetics of tuberculosis treatment toxicity and effectiveness in a large Brazilian cohort

finding: Included in the determination of NAT2 acetylator status; slow acetylators demonstrated a higher risk of treatment-related adverse events.
title: Pharmacogenetics of tuberculosis treatment toxicity and effectiveness in a large Brazilian cohort

finding: As another SNP defining NAT2 acetylator status, it demonstrated relevance to treatment-related adverse events.
title: Pharmacogenetics of tuberculosis treatment toxicity and effectiveness in a large Brazilian cohort

finding: Linking this tagging polymorphism to decreased risk of grade 2 adverse events, yet with no prior associations reported with tuberculosis treatment.
title: Pharmacogenetics of tuberculosis treatment toxicity and effectiveness in a large Brazilian cohort

finding: The SNP rs16906115, located near IL7, was associated with increased incidence of all-grade immune related adverse events (irAEs), evidenced by a hazard ratio of 2.1 (p=1.6×10^-11). This finding replicated across three independent cohorts, confirming the involvement of this variant in the immune response of patients undergoing immune checkpoint inhibitors.
title: Germline variants associated with immunotherapy-related adverse events

finding: The rs7816685 SNP was nominated as a likely causal variant associated with the novel cryptic exon of IL7. It exhibited a substantial effect on IL7 gene splicing, with a close association (R²=0.98) to the lead junction variant identified in the GWAS, supporting its role in lymphocyte homeostasis and potential modulation of irAE outcomes.
title: Germline variants associated with immunotherapy-related adverse events

finding: The intergenic SNP rs112875651 was found near TRIB1 and was associated with lipid metabolism, notably triglycerides, indicating its relevance in hepatic lipid homeostasis and its previously established relationship with circulating lipid levels.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs8192330 was associated with SFTPC isoforms and correlated with significantly decreased SFTPC levels in COVID-19 patients with higher viral loads.
title: Integration of GWAS and multi-omic QTLs identifies uncharacterized COVID-19 gene-biotype and phenotype associations

finding: SNP rs2980871 was found on chromosome 8 and was significantly associated with NLR, showing a beta coefficient of 0.04 and a p-value of 4.64 x 10^-8. The SNP was linked with the gene Tribbles homolog 1 (TRIB1), which in mouse models affects hepatic lipid synthesis and glycogenesis, emphasizing its potential relevance to inflammation.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study of neutrophil-lymphocyte ratio and polygenic risk score development to explore causal association with diabetic retinopathy

finding: The SNP rs11136000 was found relevant in associations concerning AD risk due to interactions with other AD-related variants.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: The SNP rs7013955 on chromosome 8 was also found to be significantly associated with MSA, showing a P-value of 3.7 x 10-6 and an odds ratio of 1.8 (95% CI = 1.40-2.31). This SNP was mapped to the LOXL2 gene.
title: Genome-wide association study of autopsy-confirmed Multiple System Atrophy identifies common variants near ZIC1 and ZIC4

finding: The rs7982 SNP within the CLU gene was found significant in a PAD analysis (P=7.81e-11) in relation to AD pathology and amyloid burden.
title: Connecting genomic and proteomic signatures of amyloid burden in the brain

finding: This variant was observed in Hispanic non-diabetic carriers showing higher fasting glucose levels compared to non-carriers, suggesting its importance in understanding T2D risk factors.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: The SNP rs35863913 was also a non-synonymous variant associated with pelvic organ prolapse. It was found in strong linkage disequilibrium with the lead signals (r2=0.73), highlighting its significance in the genetic framework related to POP with a p-value of 3.05 × 10^-7. This SNP was considered a positive original finding important for understanding the genetic risk factors.
title: Advancing our understanding of genetic risk factors and potential personalized strategies in pelvic organ prolapse: largest GWAS to date reveals 19 novel associated loci

finding: The locus at 8p21.2 (rs117325001) surpassed significance thresholds in schizophrenia studies and was connected to genetic influences on brain processes related to psychiatric ailments.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and SCZ in East Asians

finding: This variant showed strong associations with pneumonia in specific populations, marking its clinical significance.
title: Impact of natural selection on global patterns of genetic variation, and association with clinical phenotypes, at genes involved in SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: Noted for significant associations with various disorders in African populations.
title: Impact of natural selection on global patterns of genetic variation, and association with clinical phenotypes, at genes involved in SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: The SNP rs118072448 is upstream of MSR1, which encodes a macrophage scavenger receptor with implications in host viral defense mechanisms, highlighting its importance in the immune response to COVID-19.
title: Development and validation of a clinical and genetic model for predicting risk of severe COVID-19

finding: The BIN3 rs2280104 T allele correlated with excessive daytime sleepiness and altered network topology in Parkinson's disease, signifying its influence on non-motor symptoms and network organization.
title: Striatal dopamine depletion drives disease progression and network topology aberrations specifically by impairing left M1 network

finding: The lead SNP on chromosome 8 was associated with neuroticism, showing that the effect allele (C) increased risk for ASD while decreasing risk for ADHD, highlighting the differential genetic associations with neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Identification of shared and differentiating genetic risk for autism spectrum disorder, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder and case subgroups

finding: The study by Liu et al. (2019) found that the IgG galactosylation status combined with the SNP MYOM2-rs2294066 was able to precisely predict the response to anti-TNF therapy in patients with ankylosing spondylitis. This finding indicated the potential usefulness of this genetic marker in stratifying patients for treatment efficacy.
title: Understanding the role and adoption of artificial intelligence techniques in rheumatology research: an in-depth review of the literature

finding: The SNP rs13266634 was related to the SLC30A8 gene, which was implicated in type 2 diabetes (T2D). Genetic association studies showed that this polymorphism had functional effects on isolated human pancreatic islets. Individuals with specific alleles of rs13266634 were found to exhibit altered cellular functions contributing to T2D risk.
title: Complete loss of SLC30A8 in humans improves glucose metabolism and beta cell function

finding: The SNP rs10956955 was found to be genome-wide significant and was noted to be in linkage disequilibrium with rs4961212. It was associated with various factors related to neurodevelopmental traits.
title: Genetic and phenotypic heterogeneity in early neurodevelopmental traits in the Norwegian Mother, Father and Child Cohort Study

finding: The SNP rs4961212 was in linkage disequilibrium with rs10956955, which was associated with multiple neurodevelopmental traits and highlighted in the GWAS as having implications for understanding the genetic underpinnings of neurodevelopment.
title: Genetic and phenotypic heterogeneity in early neurodevelopmental traits in the Norwegian Mother, Father and Child Cohort Study

finding: The 8p21 variant rs191420549 demonstrated a large association with HGSOC, presenting the highest relative risk (RR) among reported SNPs. This variant is located near the CDCA2 gene, involved in the cell cycle and DNA damage response.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study of 398,238 women unveils seven novel loci associated with high-grade serous epithelial ovarian cancer risk

finding: The variant rs10094888, located near the SLURP2 gene, was identified in the context of dermatophytosis, highlighting its intersection with skin expression profiles and immune response.
title: The genetic basis of dermatophytosis skin infection susceptibility

finding: The low-frequent missense variant rs204781 within IMPA1 was linked to a decreased risk state across 48 diseases, most strongly for iron deficiency anemia with a beta of -0.16 and a p-value of 7.2×10^-16.
title: A predictive atlas of disease onset from retinal fundus photographs

finding: Identified at the GGH locus, this SNP was linked to vitamin E levels, underlining its importance in vitamin regulation.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: This locus presented a connection to the metabolic processing of 11-Deoxycorticosterone (DOC) levels.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: This SNP portrayed its relevance to metabolic processes and trace element interactions.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The SNP rs505460 was associated with differential expression of the calcium-binding gene neurocalcin delta (NCALD) at the exon level ENSE00001231633 in a variant-dependent manner, highlighting the importance of examining single-exon gene expression in understanding cortical dysregulation related to psychiatric disorders.
title: Variant-risk-exon interplay impacts circadian rhythm and dopamine signaling pathway in severe psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs73229090 was located in an intron of the non-coding gene GULOP on chromosome 8 and was identified as the strongest locus with a p value of 1.5e-62. This SNP replicated previous associations with schizophrenia (Scz), cannabis use disorder (CanUD), and tobacco smoking (Smk), and it served as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for multiple genes including EPHX2, CHRNA2, and CCDC25.
title: Cross-ancestry genetic investigation of schizophrenia, cannabis use disorder, and tobacco smoking

finding: An intronic variant in the HAS2 gene, this SNP also showed significant association with ascending aortic distensibility.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The SNP rs75772194 was identified as a positive outlier in non-dense area instruments and was associated with breast size. This SNP highlighted the complexity of genetic contributions to breast density and cancer risk.
title: The mediating role of mammographic density in the protective effect of early-life adiposity on breast cancer risk: a multivariable Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs113623975 near the GULOP pseudogene was primarily associated with both COPD and lung cancer, contributing to the understanding of shared genetic factors in respiratory diseases.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: The SNP rs56223946 also near the GULOP pseudogene was found to have associations primarily with COPD and lung cancer, emphasizing its relevance in respiratory disease genetics.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: The SNP rs11778371 related to CHRNA2 was significantly represented in the findings for lung cancer in the meta-analysis results, highlighting its potential role in cancer pathogenesis.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: This cis-sentinel SNP was linked to testosterone levels, showing a significant effect size and no evidence of reverse causality.
title: Efficient candidate drug target discovery through proteogenomics in a Scottish cohort

finding: The SNP rs79670367 at 8q24.22 within LINC01591 was recognized as a genome-wide significant locus for breast texture variation (P = 2.38 × 10−8 for VSUM). This locus has not been associated with mammographic density or breast cancer risk.
title: A genome-wide association study of mammographic texture variation

finding: Identified as rs13256025 at 8p21.2 within EBF2, this SNP showed significant association with texture variation (P = 5.74 × 10−5), although previously associated with breast cancer risk rather than with MD.
title: A genome-wide association study of mammographic texture variation

finding: The SNP rs34173062 in the SHARPIN region exhibited a significant association with LOAD, recording a P-value of 1.56×10^-9 in stage 2, thus contributing to the understanding of genetic risk for Alzheimer's disease.
The rs7341557 variant showed a significant association with a P-value of 5.33×10^-11, marking it as a novel finding in the intersection of common variants and LOAD risk.

The SNP rs678347, linked to GRHL2, was noted to increase the risk for rheumatoid arthritis (RA) when the minor allele was present, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors involved in RA susceptibility.
title: Location of joint involvement differentiates Rheumatoid arthritis into different clinical subsets

finding: The SNP rs752993, which is nearest to the gene CHRNA2, was associated with eosinophil counts. This finding likely has implications in COPD as eosinophils are involved in inflammatory responses in the lungs.
title: Leveraging deep-learning on raw spirograms to improve genetic understanding and risk scoring of COPD despite noisy labels

finding: SNP rs117746305 was associated with FZD3 and contributed to the understanding of Wnt/β-catenin signaling's role in COPD.
title: Leveraging deep-learning on raw spirograms to improve genetic understanding and risk scoring of COPD despite noisy labels

finding: The SNP rs10092045, associated with SFRP1, was found to further establish the role of Wnt/β-catenin in COPD pathogenesis.
title: Leveraging deep-learning on raw spirograms to improve genetic understanding and risk scoring of COPD despite noisy labels

finding: The SNP rs10503253 was identified as a genome-wide associated variant linked to the risk of schizophrenia, as highlighted in the research by Donohoe et al. (2013). This finding was significant within the context of intellectual disability (ID), as the study observed that de novo mutations (DNMs) enriched in fetal brain-specific enhancers were related to genes involved in ID. Specifically, it was suggested that regulatory variants, including this SNP, could play a role in the aetiology of ID through their influence on gene expression in critical regions of the developing human brain.
title: Regulatory de novo mutations underlying intellectual disability

finding: This intergenic variant associated with ossification of the longitudinal ligament showed a significant connection with otosclerosis but generated no comprehensive analysis.
title: Genome-wide Screen of Otosclerosis in Population Biobanks: 18 Loci and Shared Heritability with Skeletal Structure

finding: The SNP rs62523863 was analyzed in relation to systolic blood pressure (SBP) and its causal association with PhenoAgeAccel. When excluding outlier SNPs, the MR-PRESSO analysis suggested a potentially positive association where genetically predicted higher SBP was linked to an increase in PhenoAgeAccel by approximately 0.038 years per 1-mmHg increase in SBP.
title: Causal associations of education, lifestyle behaviors, and cardiometabolic traits with epigenetic age acceleration: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: At DLC1 on 8p22, rs139904273 was significantly associated with SCC, showing a higher odds ratio in African American populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Located in VPS13B on 8q22.2, rs182805930 was found to have significant associations with SCC and highlighted the genetic variance across populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This intergenic variation near CSMD3 on 8q23.3 was associated with SCC and revealed significant genetic signals across diverse ancestry populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: In the EPHX2 gene, variant rs72477506 was associated with lung cancer risk and exhibited a protective effect in European populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Identified in relation to MAPK15, where gene expressions enhanced in the choroid plexus suggest a role in IIH. This SNP was linked to deleterious predictions.
title: The genetics of idiopathic intracranial hypertension (IIH): Integration of population studies and clinical data

finding: The SNP rs6995270 near ST3GAL1 showed a previously unreported GWAS association with sialic acid and various glycans, suggesting its involvement in glycosylation processes that may influence complex disorders.
title: The Molecular Human – A Roadmap of Molecular Interactions Linking Multiomics Networks with Disease Endpoints

finding: The SNP rs17721179 near ST3GAL1 was linked to sialic acid and multiple glycans in a newly identified GWAS association, highlighting its potential role in the modulation of glycosylation related to disease pathology.
