title: The Molecular Human – A Roadmap of Molecular Interactions Linking Multiomics Networks with Disease Endpoints

finding: The SNP rs2945738 associated with ST3GAL1 was discovered to have relationships with sialic acid and numerous glycans, pointing towards its significance in complex molecular mechanisms associated with various pathologies.
title: The Molecular Human – A Roadmap of Molecular Interactions Linking Multiomics Networks with Disease Endpoints

finding: The finding of rs13264936 near ST3GAL1 revealed a previously unknown association with sialic acid and different glycans, suggesting its critical role in glycosylation processes that may impact health outcomes.
title: The Molecular Human – A Roadmap of Molecular Interactions Linking Multiomics Networks with Disease Endpoints

finding: This SNP was associated with COVID-19+ diarrhea with an odds ratio of 0.94, indicating that the risk allele G was linked to a lower likelihood of experiencing diarrhea during acute SARS-CoV2 infection. The finding was significant in a large multi-ancestry analysis and was primarily driven by individuals of European ancestry. Furthermore, it demonstrated strong associations with high cholesterol and irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), specifically IBS-D.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of diarrhea during acute SARS-CoV2 infection identifies multiple novel loci and contrasting etiological roles of irritable bowel syndrome subtypes

finding: The variant rs72725854 was associated with prostate cancer, specifically located near the long non-coding RNA PCAT2. This SNP was enriched in African populations and has been reported to increase the risk of prostate cancer two-fold.
title: Diversity and Scale: Genetic Architecture of 2,068 Traits in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: SNP rs67172995 was also stably prioritized by lo-siRF as an epistatic interactor variant, contributing to the complex genetic architecture related to cardiac hypertrophy.
title: Epistasis regulates genetic control of cardiac hypertrophy

finding: In this study, rs1961102 was one of the four SNPs associated with QTc duration when analyzed individually, further supporting its relevance in the context of QT prolongation.
title: Genetic QT Score and Sleep Apnea as Predictors of Sudden Cardiac Death in the UK Biobank

finding: This missense variant on the SHARPIN gene was recognized as a known AD risk locus involved in postsynaptic function. It also showed eQTL effects on increased expression of ZNF707 in the anterior cingulate, linking it directly to the neurobiology of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Identification of novel associations of candidate loci with Alzheimer’s disease by leveraging the shared genetic basis with hippocampal volume

finding: The analysis revealed that the T allele of BIN3 rs2280104 was associated with excessive daytime sleepiness in PD patients and was also tied to changes in network topology, implying its role in non-motor symptoms related to the disease.
title: High-level anxiety is associated with worse clinical symptoms and aberrant brain networks in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The study found a strong linkage disequilibrium (LD) between rs1801280 and rs1799931 of the NAT2 gene. This SNP was associated with the intermediate acetylator phenotype, which was prevalent in approximately 46.1% of the TB patients, implying a significant role in drug metabolism that is relevant to anti-tuberculosis treatment.
title: Polymorphism of NAT2, PXR, ABCB1, and GSTT1 genes among tuberculosis patients of North Eastern States of India

finding: Similar to rs1801280, rs1799931 exhibited strong linkage disequilibrium with rs1801280 and was linked to the NAT2 enzyme activity. It also contributed to the classification of TB patients predominantly as intermediate acetylators, highlighting its relevance in acetylation statuses affecting drug response.
title: Polymorphism of NAT2, PXR, ABCB1, and GSTT1 genes among tuberculosis patients of North Eastern States of India

finding: The SNP rs1799930 was part of the observed linkage disequilibrium with rs1801280 and rs1799931 in the context of NAT2 genotypes. Although it did not specifically highlight acetylation statuses, its inclusion in the LD analysis indicated its significance in the metabolic pathways relevant to AT-DILI.
title: Polymorphism of NAT2, PXR, ABCB1, and GSTT1 genes among tuberculosis patients of North Eastern States of India

finding: The SNP rs117296832 showed nearly genome-wide significant association with AD (P=1.1×10^-7) among APOE ε2 subjects. This finding was a notable result of the genome-wide association study (GWAS) focused on ε2 carriers.
title: Protein phosphatase 2A, complement component 4, and APOE genotype linked to Alzheimer’s disease using a systems biology approach

finding: SNP rs4735444 was involved in the verification of super-variant chr8_99 in three repetitions, indicating its role in genetic susceptibility related to various super-variant associations.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: High-risk variant rs2943549 was identified as the most strongly associated with urate-related phenotypes and located in a region accessible in proximal tubular cells, indicating its role as a regulatory element in hyperuricemia.
title: Locus-specific stratification and prioritization unveil high risk genes underlying hyperuricemia

finding: The SNP rs7840270 was located just 0.3 kb upstream of the ADAM9 gene and was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for blood expression, demonstrating a significant association with disease severity in COVID-19. Specifically, the higher expressing allele C was found to be more frequent in critical COVID-19 patients compared to noncritical patients (71.3% vs. 50%) with an odds ratio of 2.48 (P=0.017), thus indicating its role in increased ADAM9 expression linked to severe COVID-19.
title: Identification of driver genes for severe forms of COVID-19 in a deeply phenotyped young patient cohort

finding: Among IDH-mutant 1p/19q-codeleted gliomas treated with TMZ, rs7840433-A near NEIL2 was significantly linked with decreased survival times. It yielded a hazard ratio of 2.33 and a median decrease in survival of 81 months (p=0.0229).
title: Functional germline variants in DNA damage repair pathways are associated with altered survival in adults with glioma treated with temozolomide

finding: The SNP rs4737010 located in the first intron of ANK1 was associated with lowered spleen iron levels (beta=-0.077, p=1.0e-17). Its position within a regulatory region suggests a role in the expression and possibly the functional characteristics of erythrocytes.
title: Analysis of MRI-derived spleen iron in the UK Biobank identifies genetic variation linked to iron homeostasis and erythrocyte morphology

finding: This SNP was also linked to left ventricular end-systolic volume (LVESV) in both the UK Biobank and Biobank Japan studies, reinforcing its role in cardiac morphology.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: This SNP was identified in multiple brain eQTLs linking functional traits of both cardiac and cognitive health.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs13279405 was associated with chest pain as an adverse event after vaccination with either the BNT162b1 or mRNA-1273 vaccines.
title: Identification of susceptibility loci for adverse events following COVID-19 vaccination in the Japanese population: A web-based genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs60528951 was identified as a novel locus associated with the complete blood count (CBC) setpoints. This finding was significant as it contributed to the understanding of genetic determinants impacting hematologic regulation.
title: Hematologic setpoints are a stable and patient-specific deep phenotype

finding: The SNP rs2047265 was found to be a novel locus associated with CBC setpoints. Its identification was important for discovering genetic influences on blood count metrics specific to patient physiology.
title: Hematologic setpoints are a stable and patient-specific deep phenotype

finding: The SNP rs6997857 emerged as a novel locus linked to CBC setpoints, indicating its relevance in the genetic framework of blood count regulation.
title: Hematologic setpoints are a stable and patient-specific deep phenotype

finding: The variant rs2553268 was associated with body weight and linked to the gene WRN, which is associated with Werner Syndrome, abnormal fat distribution, and short stature. This finding contributed significantly to the leading factor for BMI, which identified 31 brain cell types as enriched.
title: A scalable variational approach to characterize pleiotropic components across thousands of human diseases and complex traits using GWAS summary statistics

finding: Mapped for prostate cancer and located within the 8q24 gene desert.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: Also mapped for prostate cancer and associated with other uncharacterized loci.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: Associated with CSI thickening, this SNP further highlighted the complex roles of AMD risk variants in retinal structure alterations under pathological conditions.
title: Photoreceptor layer thinning is an early biomarker for age-related macular degeneration development: Epidemiological and genetic evidence from UK Biobank optical coherence tomography data

finding: The SNP rs10503253 at the CSMD1 locus was associated with schizophrenia in an Asian population, indicating potential relevance to neurodevelopmental outcomes. In the context of the study, this SNP was linked to placental DNA methylation modules that correlated with maternal PCB levels and child neurodevelopment, particularly relating to autism spectrum disorder (ASD) risk. The finding suggested a broader implication of CSMD1 in neurodevelopmental disorders, especially in connection with environmental factors like maternal PCB exposure.
title: Networks of placental DNA methylation correlate with maternal serum PCB concentrations and child neurodevelopment

finding: The SNP rs1065712 was also part of a credible set for AD, supported by previous studies indicating its importance.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis and fine-mapping in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs34674752 was mentioned with a likelihood indicating it plays a role in Alzheimer's disease risk according to fine-mapping results.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis and fine-mapping in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs1532276 was found to be important in the context of heterogeneous ancestry in relation to Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis and fine-mapping in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The variant rs11778664, placed on chromosome 8 at position 17893510, was the lead variant linked to FGL1 in the regional association plots. This variant also showed a significant association with T2D in the multi-ancestry genome-wide association study (GWAS).
title: Circulating proteomic profiles are associated with the onset of type 2 diabetes in a multi-ethnic Asian population – a longitudinal study

finding: The SNP rs6990255 corresponded to RPL10AP3 and was notably identified in the analysis for shared genomic loci between BDI and BDII. The finding emphasized the genetic connections between these two bipolar disorder subtypes.
title: Patterns of convergence and divergence between bipolar disorder type I and type II: evidence from integrative genomic analyses

finding: The genetic variant rs804279, located in the GATA4/NEIL2 region, showed a significant association with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) with an odds ratio of 1.14 (95% CI: 1.10-1.18; P=3.76×10−12). It was also linked to polycystic ovarian morphology and ovulatory dysfunction, although significant heterogeneity was observed among different studies.
title: Mendelian randomization analysis identified potential genes pleiotropically associated with polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The SNP rs77668120 showed significant association with tuberculosis (p=6.3E-05), replicating earlier findings from previous GWAS studies on tuberculosis.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: The missense variant rs6998061 in POU5F1B was associated with prostate and colorectal cancers, predicted as a possibly damaging SNP. POU5F1B was noted for its potential role in tumorigenicity, promoting angiogenesis, and inhibiting apoptosis in cancer cells.
title: Exome-wide association studies discover germline mutation patterns and identify high-risk populations in human cancers

finding: The SNP rs7814941 located in GSDMC had significant associations with lumbar disc herniation (LDH), particularly noted for a marked increase in disease severity accumulation in individuals homozygous for the effect allele before the age of 30.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis conducted in three large biobanks expands the genetic landscape of lumbar disc herniations

finding: The SNP rs10099100 was identified as a significant finding in the GenomicSEM ASD GWAS. It was also one of five loci established in the univariate ASD GWAS, indicating its relevance to autism spectrum disorder.
title: Enhancing the Discriminatory Power of ADHD and Autism Spectrum Disorder Polygenic Scores in Clinical and Non-Clinical Samples

finding: The SNP rs2952183 was significantly related to the gut microbiota class Bacilli with p-values of 0.00001, indicating a potential role of this SNP in mediating the relationship between selenium and congenital foot deformities.
title: The Mendelian randomization analysis of trace elements Zinc, Selenium, Copper, Iron, and Phosphate with congenital foot deformities

finding: The intronic variant rs531178459 in the ADAM32 gene gained significance in the conditional GWAS analysis, indicating a previously unrecognized association with delirium.
title: Dissecting the genetic and proteomic risk factors for delirium

finding: The rs2279590 variant in the CLU gene showed a protective association (Odds Ratio of 0.992, p = 4.2×10^-8) in relation to delirium, linking it to pathways involved in neurodegenerative processes.
title: Dissecting the genetic and proteomic risk factors for delirium

finding: The SNP rs10283378 showed significant association with the risk gene EPHX2, underscoring its relevance within the genetic landscape of OCC.
title: Integrated multi-omics data analysis identifies a novel genetics-risk gene of IRF4 associated with prognosis of oral cavity cancer

finding: The SNP rs17321515 located in the TRIB1 gene was studied for its interaction with coffee drinking and its influence on coronary heart disease in a Taiwanese population. The research indicated a significant interaction between this SNP and coffee consumption, suggesting that genetic variation at this locus may modify the risk of developing coronary heart disease associated with coffee intake. This finding contributes to the understanding of the genetic factors influencing coronary heart disease, emphasizing the importance of lifestyle factors such as diet in genetic risk assessments.
title: Core outcome set for clinical trials of stent implantation in coronary heart disease -- a systematic review and mixed-method consensus study

finding: The SNP rs2042528 was part of the 81 identified SNPs that showed significant interaction with fish oil supplementation. Its interaction pattern differed from that of APOE ε4, indicating a unique genetic influence on dementia outcomes.
title: Gene-diet interaction analysis in UK Biobank identified genetic loci that modify the association between fish oil supplementation and the incidence of dementia

finding: The rs6992534 variant, found in the ERI1 gene (Exoribonuclease 1), was also noted among the four novel variants related to sVEGFR2 levels in the GWAS meta-analysis. Similar to rs9411335, higher levels of sVEGFR2 predicted by this SNP conferred a reduced risk of MP, indicated by an odds ratio of 0.86.
title: Genetic Evidence for Soluble VEGFR2 as a Protective Factor Against Macular Pucker

finding: Found near LOC157273, this variant was associated with direct effects on AUD, supporting its relevance to alcohol use.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: The SNP rs75777619 at 8q24.21 was positively associated with ALL susceptibility. Its effects were significant in at least three ALL cell lines as shown in the study, aligning with the findings of the other mentioned variants.
title: Functional investigation of inherited noncoding genetic variation impacting the pharmacogenomics of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia treatment

finding: SNP rs17055585 was another candidate identified in the AFR cohort linked with cardiovascular traits and confirmed with a significant association (p=2.6 x 10^-09), making it a positive and original finding.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: SNP rs3019892 emerged as a novel finding associated with cardiovascular traits in the AFR population, affirming it as a positive and original finding.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: SNP rs10096421 was prominent in the AFR population, linked to cardiovascular traits, hence recognized as a positive and original finding.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: SNP rs35499486 was noted for its high prevalence in the AFR population, establishing it as a positive and original finding within cardiovascular associations.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: Variant rs117157809 located in the Tankyrase (TNKS) gene was found to be significantly associated with radiotherapy-induced oral mucositis (OM) in nasopharyngeal carcinoma (NPC) patients. TNKS plays a role in telomere capping and maintenance of telomerase activity.
title: Systematic Review of Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Acute Pain and Relevant Acute Toxicities Induced by Radiotherapy for Head and Neck Cancer

finding: The SNP rs34173062, associated with SHARPIN, was first observed in larger studies and replicated here with a P-value of 1.81×10^-9 across diverse ancestry groups, reinforcing its association with AD.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis of 56,241 individuals identifies LRRC4C, LHX5-AS1 and nominates ancestry-specific loci PTPRK, GRB14, and KIAA0825 as novel risk loci for Alzheimer’s disease: the Alzheimer’s Disease Genetics Consortium

finding: The SNP rs10957712 was associated with the GDAP1 locus at 8q21.11, achieving a significant result (P = 4.19x10-7), suggesting its importance in endometriosis genetics.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs115849089 demonstrated potential associations with IHD (OR_IVW = 1.004, 95% CI: 1.001–1.007, p = 0.005) and myocardial infarction (OR_IVW = 1.001, 95% CI: 0.999–1.003, p = 0.199), indicating its relevance in cardiovascular health.
title: Causality of Genetically Determined Monounsaturated Fatty Acids on Risk of Cardiovascular Disease: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The rs6990375 SNP in the SULF1 gene was significantly associated with fetus failure in the context of IVF techniques, suggesting its importance in reproductive health.
title: Variability in proteoglycan biosynthetic genes reveals new facets of heparan sulfates diversity. A systematic review and analysis

finding: The SNP rs1293298, located within the CTSB gene in the context of the largest PD GWAS, was linked with the methylation probe cg14458991. This probe positioned next to the FDFT1 gene showed direct correlation with striatal DAT binding, shedding light on its role in dopaminergic pathology.
title: Epigenetic and cognitive signatures of striatal DAT binding among healthy elderly individuals

finding: The SNP rs13281615 in PCAT1 was highly associated with breast cancer in both the AI-based and combined approaches, even though it did not appear in the case-control analysis but was reported in other breast cancer studies.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: SNP rs15285 located in LPL was found associated with hypercholesterolemia utilizing the CC-liability method and appeared significant in other GWAS studies of the UK Biobank.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs79574881 was recognized as a novel variant in the meta-analysis of smoking behaviors, specifically associated with smoking initiation. It is located on the DLC1 gene and demonstrated a beta value of -0.02, with a p-value of 2.84 × 10^-8.
title: Evaluation of the Causal Relationship Between Smoking and Schizophrenia in Asia

finding: In the context of glioma, rs139944315 was associated with tumor mutational burden (TMB) and correlated with the expression of the WRN gene.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: The SNP rs75547282 was proposed as a risk variant for autism spectrum disorder. The comprehensive integrative analysis highlighted its significance in the context of autism-related traits and genetic risk factors, thereby contributing to understanding the genetic underpinnings of autism.
title: An unbiased de novo network analysis uncovering causal genes and the developmental intersection between autism and co-occurring traits

finding: In the genome-wide association study, rs6601299 was identified as one of the lead SNPs associated with circulating retinol, with consistent effect sizes noted in replication efforts described in multiple cohorts, implying its significance in retinol metabolism.
title: Genetic influences on circulating retinol and its relationship to human health

finding: SNP rs6469450 was an intronic variant in CSMD3 identified as novel in AUD analysis.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The SNP rs10104815 was nominally significant in the meta-analysis involving 21,147 individuals related to SNRI non-response. It has also been previously reported in another GWAS study from the 23andMe Team. The associated nearby gene was KHDRBS3.
title: Genome-wide meta-analyses of non-response to antidepressants identify novel loci and potential drugs

finding: The SNP rs9642880 was identified as a strong indicator of bladder cancer risk, showing variance that correlated with increased susceptibility assessed across several studies.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: The missense mutation SNP rs2294008 in the PSCA gene consistently correlated with bladder cancer risk across multiple population studies.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: The SNP rs55705857 (A>G) conferred a 6-fold increased risk of developing IDH-mutant low-grade glioma (LGG) and was identified as the causal variant associated with molecular pathways that drive LGG. Fine-mapping established that rs55705857 resided within a brain-specific enhancer disrupting OCT2/4 binding, which in turn increased interaction with the Myc promoter and elevated Myc expression. The rs55705857 G risk allele significantly influenced gliomagenesis, demonstrated by mouse models where mutations at this locus accelerated tumor development and increased penetrance. Overall, it was concluded that rs55705857 played a crucial role in the heritable predisposition to approximately 40% of LGG patients.
title: A non-coding single nucleotide polymorphism at 8q24 drives IDH1-mutant glioma formation

finding: The rs35006907-C allele was found to be associated with a higher risk of dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) and increased expression of MTSS1 in European and Han Chinese populations, suggesting a genomic mechanism linking this variant to cardiac phenotypes. This association was confirmed through expressed quantitative trait locus (eQTL) analyses.
title: Reduced Expression of MTSS1 Increases Sarcomere Number and Improves Contractility in Select Forms of Monogenic DCM

finding: The T allele of rs12541595 was linked to lower left ventricular expression of MTSS1 and was associated with significantly improved event-free survival from cardiovascular death or heart transplant among individuals with pathogenic mutations in TTN who also carried this allele. This finding highlights the protective role of reduced levels of MTSS1 in the context of contractile dysfunction underlying TTN-associated DCM.
title: Reduced Expression of MTSS1 Increases Sarcomere Number and Improves Contractility in Select Forms of Monogenic DCM

finding: The variant rs11780471 was linked to multiple smoking phenotypes, where the major allele (A) was associated with an increased risk of smoking initiation, a lower age at initiation, and decreased methylation levels in the gene CHRNA2.
title: Smoking-informed methylation and expression QTLs in human brain and colocalization with smoking-associated genetic loci

finding: The study identified rs1037699 as a missense variant in the RRM2B locus, which showed a significant association with somatic hypermutation (SHM) patterns. Conditioning by this missense variant canceled the association of the lead variant in the same locus, indicating its functional relevance in SHM processes.
title: Multimodal repertoire analysis unveils B cell biology in health and immune-mediated diseases

finding: Variant rs892503 in the RRM2B locus demonstrated an association with SHM patterns, although it was not in linkage disequilibrium with any missense variant. The residual association for this variant showed near perfect co-localization with expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) effects for the long non-coding RNA AP002852.2 in plasmablasts.
title: Multimodal repertoire analysis unveils B cell biology in health and immune-mediated diseases

finding: In the analysis of the NUGGC locus, rs2305453 was examined alongside other variants. Regional association plots indicated significant associations with SHM patterns, highlighting its potential involvement in nucleotide substitution processes.
title: Multimodal repertoire analysis unveils B cell biology in health and immune-mediated diseases

finding: Similar to rs2305453, rs13279787 was part of the NUGGC locus analysis, where it was associated with SHM patterns as indicated in regional association plots, reflecting its potential role in the biological processes underlying SHM.
title: Multimodal repertoire analysis unveils B cell biology in health and immune-mediated diseases

finding: The variant rs4732620 in the NUGGC locus was also identified in regional association plots, showing a significant association with SHM patterns. This suggests its involvement in the genetic factors affecting SHM in the context of the studied immune-mediated diseases.
title: Multimodal repertoire analysis unveils B cell biology in health and immune-mediated diseases

finding: This SNP was noted for showing a moderate decrease in PPLD after filtering for DMD Dup2 mutations, but it still maintained a significant PPLD value, contributing evidence to its association with disease severity.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of loss of ambulation in dystrophinopathy patients suggests multiple candidate modifiers of disease severity

finding: At the SLC30A8 locus, this intergenic variant was significantly associated with FG and showed high linkage (R2 > 0.95) to previously identified lead variants. Its activity was linked to enhancer regions relevant for islet function.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: This previously known lead variant at the SLC30A8 locus was associated with FG, linked to rs35859536 and shown to be in islet-specific enhancer regions relevant for glucose metabolism.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: As another lead variant near SLC30A8, it was previously associated with FG and triglyceride levels, supporting its role in glycemic traits.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: Identified as a rare variant at the SLC30A8 locus in the Asian population, this variant was associated with FG and indicated race-specificity, suggesting distinct genetic contributions in this cohort.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: The rs189796944 variant, which is an intronic variant in DPYSL2, reached genome-wide significance in interactions with both TRS (beta coefficient exceeding 0.060, p<9.04×10<sup>-9</sup>) and Physical Survival TSLEs (beta coefficient greater than 0.127, p<4×10<sup>-8</sup>). This indicated its involvement in PTSD risk linked to traumatic experiences, as DPYSL2 is important for neuronal growth and has been implicated in multiple neurological disorders.
title: Disentangling the roles of trauma and genetics in psychiatric disorders using an Electronic Health Records-based approach

finding: The index variant rs144958026 was identified at the genomic risk locus located at region 8p21.3, which was found to be intronic within the LPL gene encoding lipoprotein lipase. This variant had a highly significant p-value of 5.51×10^-65, indicating its strong association with heart failure.
title: Exploring novel risk loci for heart failure and the shared genetic etiology with blood lipids, blood pressure, and blood glucose: a large-scale multi-trait association analysis

finding: The SNP rs16902085 was associated with MYC in prostate cancer and confirmed its oncogenic role through functional analysis.
title: Large-scale alternative polyadenylation (APA)-wide association studies to identify putative susceptibility genes in human common cancers

finding: The study established that cg25926804 mediated 28.6% of the effect of rs6991078 on changes in IFN-γ levels following BCG vaccination. cg25926804 is located near the TMEM75 and GSDMC genes, the latter of which had been previously reported to be involved in defense responses to bacterial infections.
title: Epigenetic Reprogramming Mediates Monocyte and Heterologous T Cell-derived Cytokine Responses after BCG Vaccination

finding: The SNP rs1905014-T was significantly associated with optic disc size, indicating its potential role in affecting eye abnormalities within the context of PHACE syndrome. This finding was relevant to the overall etiology of PHACE, a condition characterized by developmental anomalies and vascular birthmarks.
title: Analysis of Whole Genome Sequencing in a Cohort of Individuals with PHACE Syndrome Suggests Dysregulation of RAS/PI3K Signaling

finding: The SNP rs1801280 was related to the classification of individuals into slow and rapid metabolizer phenotypes of N-acetyltransferase 2 (NAT2). This SNP, associated with the NAT2*5 haplotype, indicated a potential for adverse drug reactions and variable responses to medications like simvastatin, showing a robust association with drug metabolism. Incidentally, there were no associations found between the NAT2 haplotypes *6 or *7 in relation to simvastatin use, suggesting that the primary effects were evident only between *1 and *5 haplotypes.
title: Biobank scale pharmacogenomics informs the genetic underpinnings of simvastatin use

finding: The <italic>BIN3</italic> rs2280104 T allele was found to be negatively associated with scores of the Epworth Sleepiness Scale (ESS) in Parkinson's disease (PD) patients. T-carriers exhibited lower ESS scores when compared to CC carriers, indicating that EDS was less frequent among T-carriers, with statistical significance observed. Additionally, the T allele's influence extended to shaping the topology of structural and functional brain networks in PD patients, specifically leading to changes in nodal metrics that correlated with ESS scores.
title: BIN3 rs2280104 T allele is associated with excessive daytime sleepiness and altered network topology in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The variant rs7461129 in the MTSS1 gene was associated with increased mRNA expression in left ventricular (LV) tissue and was found to increase the risk of developing heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (HFrEF). This finding was based on expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) and provided new evidence for drug discovery targeting HFrEF.
title: Large-scale Mendelian randomization identifies novel pathways as therapeutic targets for heart failure with reduced ejection fraction and with preserved ejection fraction

finding: The finding related to SNP rs1106634 indicated an association with the lifetime risk of depression and hippocampal neurocognitive deficits. This was important in understanding possible novel mechanisms in the etiopathology of depression, shedding light on how this genetic variant might influence neurodegenerative diseases like sporadic Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (sCJD) indirectly through its effects on neurocognition.
title: Identification of potential key genes and pathway linked with sporadic Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease based on integrated bioinformatics analyses

finding: Identified in the shared loci for anxiety and schizophrenia, indicating significant genetic interplay between these two conditions.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: Identified as one of the suggestive variants for hip BMD, rs61260287 was found in close proximity to the SNTG1 gene, suggesting its potential involvement in regulating hip BMD.
title: SEAD: an augmented reference panel with 22,134 haplotypes boosts the rare variants imputation and GWAS analysis in Asian population

finding: This SNP was included among the rare variants linked to hip BMD, emphasizing the association of variants near SNTG1 gene with this phenotype.
title: SEAD: an augmented reference panel with 22,134 haplotypes boosts the rare variants imputation and GWAS analysis in Asian population

finding: Similar to other variants mentioned, rs57319781 was found to be associated with hip BMD, supporting the connection between variations in the SNTG1 region and bone mineral density.
title: SEAD: an augmented reference panel with 22,134 haplotypes boosts the rare variants imputation and GWAS analysis in Asian population

finding: The variant rs6993752, located at the 8q11.21 locus within SNTG1, was identified as significantly associated with diabetes mellitus (DM) risk in European ancestry survivors of childhood cancer. In the discovery dataset, it had an odds ratio (OR) of 1.99 (95% CI: 1.56-2.55; P=4.4×10^-8), and replicated with an OR of 1.56 (95% CI: 1.12-2.17; P=8.1×10^-3) in Childhood Cancer Survivor Study (CCSS) survivors.
title: Trans-ancestral genetic study of diabetes mellitus risk in survivors of childhood cancer: a report from the St. Jude Lifetime Cohort and the Childhood Cancer Survivor Study

finding: The variant rs12679242, located within the intron of the CYP11B2 gene, was exclusively associated with the ICD-10 diagnosis of essential hypertension in an East Asian population. This SNP demonstrated a minor allele frequency of 0.298 in East Asian populations compared to 0.477 in non-Finnish Europeans. The risk odds ratio associated with this leading SNP was 0.87, indicating it acted as a protective variant.
title: Recessive and sex-dependent genetic effects in primary hypertension

finding: Colocalization with an eQTL acting on ANGPT1 was found for rs4496939, associated with IOP levels, suggesting a role of this pathway in regulating intraocular pressure.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: This SNP was part of the strongest signal at IOP, associated with ANGPT1 expression, further supporting its implication in vascular biology and IOP regulation.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: The SNP rs11785337 in the DLG Associated Protein 2 gene (DLGAP2) was positively associated with increased plasma OT levels (β = 0.29, p-value 8.5 × 10^-6). The association highlighted potential roles of DLGAP2 in glutamatergic signaling, further implicating it in mechanisms relevant to ASD.
title: Genetic and epigenetic signatures associated with plasma oxytocin levels in children and adolescents with autism spectrum disorder

finding: The variant rs1964514 was identified as an intronic variant in PKHD1L1, associated with multiple subtypes of female infertility. The odds ratios for its associations were F-ALL=1.13, F-EXCL=1.13, and F-INCL=1.18, indicating a positive correlation with all-cause female infertility.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The variant rs111597692 was associated with idiopathic infertility with an odds ratio of F-EXCL=1.16. It was nearest to the gene TRHR, which is linked to a phenotype similar to primary ovarian insufficiency in knockouts.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This SNP was among the top-ranking variants identified by both IBI and GWAS for hypertension (HTN). Its significance was corroborated by its high information gain relative to the trait.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: Notably, this intronic SNP in the CSMD1 gene was assigned as the top-1 SNP by IBI for 46% of HTN patients, whereas it was ranked very low in the GWAS, suggesting its unique relevance in individual genomic variation.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: The T allele of intronic variant rs146099921 was associated with a decrease of -0.12 log Hg in pregnant women (p = 8.21×10−6). This variant is located in the gene SLC39A14, a metal transporter linked to cellular uptake of cadmium, iron, manganese, and zinc, suggesting a plausible connection to the modulation of mercury levels.
title: Genome-wide association study of blood mercury in European pregnant women and children

finding: The homozygous intronic variant rs11337717 (T>C, chr12:89643729) was identified as significantly associated with the severity of COVID-19, showing a higher incidence in symptomatic patients compared to asymptomatic individuals (p=0.0004). This indicated that rs11337717 could be a genetic predisposition factor for severe COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Targeting ATP2B1 impairs PI3K/Akt/Fox-O3 signaling and reduces SARS-COV-2 replication in vivo

finding: The SNP rs1041983 was one of the seven most frequent SNPs affecting isoniazid (INH) acetylation. In the analysis, predicted acetylator types identified a substantial proportion of patients as either slow or intermediate acetylators, indirectly linking this SNP to variability in INH clearance.
title: A rapid pharmacogenomic assay to detect NAT2 polymorphisms and guide isoniazid dosing for tuberculosis treatment

finding: As part of the 7-SNP model affecting NAT2 acetylation, rs1801280 contributed to the classification of patients into slow, intermediate, and rapid acetylator types, with significant differences in INH clearance rates associated with these acetylator classifications.
title: A rapid pharmacogenomic assay to detect NAT2 polymorphisms and guide isoniazid dosing for tuberculosis treatment

finding: Included in both the 7-SNP and the subsequent 5-SNP models, rs1799929 was found to correlate with acetylator phenotype classification in TB patients, impacting the pharmacokinetics of INH treatment.
title: A rapid pharmacogenomic assay to detect NAT2 polymorphisms and guide isoniazid dosing for tuberculosis treatment

finding: SNP rs1208 was highlighted in the context of predicting INH clearance alongside other SNPs in the 5-SNP model, demonstrating its role in influencing acetylator phenotypes and thus impacting treatment outcomes for patients.
title: A rapid pharmacogenomic assay to detect NAT2 polymorphisms and guide isoniazid dosing for tuberculosis treatment

finding: SNP rs2980218 located close to the HNF4G gene on chromosome 8q21.13 was found to be significantly associated with AF with a P-value of 2.19×10^-9. This association indicates its possible role in the susceptibility to AF.
title: Identification of two new genetic loci associated with atrial fibrillation in the Taiwanese population-implication of metabolism and fibrosis in atrial fibrillation mechanism

finding: The rs2954029 SNP, located in the TRIB1 gene at 8q24.13, was significant for its association with the risk of coronary artery disease (CAD) and stroke. Specifically, individuals carrying the A allele exhibited a higher risk for both conditions, supporting the role of TRIB1 in lipid metabolism and its contribution to comorbidities with MAFLD.
title: Genome-wide insights into the shared genetic landscape between metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease and cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs11780471 located at 8p21.2 in the CHRNA2 gene was part of the smoking-related loci identified. It showed higher frequencies and greater association effects in the white population compared to the Chinese population, contributing to the ethnic disparity in lung cancer susceptibility.
title: Ethnic differences of genetic risk and smoking in lung cancer: two prospective cohort studies

finding: The rs7005606 SNP was identified as being linked to the neuregulin 1 gene (NRG1) and was found to conform to its role in raising the risk for Hirschsprung disease (HSCR). This highlighted its potential significance in the genetic predisposition to the disorder.
title: Size matters: large copy number losses reveal novel Hirschsprung disease genes

finding: The missense variant rs771722367 in ADRA1A was associated with the volume of the left ventral diencephalon, with an effect of 683.56 mm³ and an effect size of 1.28 standard deviations (P = 6.5 × 10^-11). This connection supported previous links between ADRA1A and schizophrenia along with brain structural changes.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: This SNP was identified as one of the strongest predictors of circulating phylloquinone, linking it to the anticoagulant effects of warfarin and the associated lower stroke risk.
title: An Informatics Consult approach for generating clinical evidence for treatment decisions

finding: The SNP rs10113238 represented the next strongest novel association, located upstream of the FBXO32 gene, which encodes a muscle-specific ubiquitin ligase that has been linked to cardiac and skeletal muscle atrophy. This SNP has also been associated with familial dilated cardiomyopathy.
title: Multi-ancestry Multivariate Genome-Wide Analysis Highlights the Role of Common Genetic Variation in Cardiac Structure, Function, and Heart Failure-related Traits

finding: The SNP rs12541595 was highlighted as being significantly associated with echocardiographic measures related to heart failure-related traits. Gene knockout studies have also linked alterations in MTSS1, the gene which this SNP affects, with heart failure outcomes.
title: Multi-ancestry Multivariate Genome-Wide Analysis Highlights the Role of Common Genetic Variation in Cardiac Structure, Function, and Heart Failure-related Traits

finding: The SNP rs7001 was associated with the gene Khdc3, which linked to hepatic metabolic defects in wild type female mice descended from ancestors with a mutation in this gene. The study indicated that not only the original mutation but also the genetic variants related to rs7001 led to transcriptional dysregulation of critical hepatic metabolic genes across generations, affecting both male and female descendants.
title: Khdc3 Regulates Metabolism Across Generations in a DNA-Independent Manner

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was associated with a notable finding in the context of intestinal tumors, as research indicated that mice lacking a Myc enhancer, which includes this SNP, exhibited resistance to such tumors. This suggested a significant role of rs6983267 in tumorigenesis, further highlighting its relevance in cancer biology.
title: Methylation-mediated retuning on the enhancer-to-silencer activity scale of networked regulatory elements guides driver-gene misregulation

finding: This SNP was found to disrupt a miRNA binding site in LPL, suggesting its role in modulating triglyceride levels and type 2 diabetes risk.
title: Genome-wide functional screen of 3’UTR variants uncovers causal variants for human disease and evolution

finding: This SNP was nominated as a causal variant associated with schizophrenia risk, providing novel functional evidence for its role.
title: Genome-wide functional screen of 3’UTR variants uncovers causal variants for human disease and evolution

finding: The SNP rs11780978 was identified as correlated with the differential expression of PLEC and was involved in the methylation quantitative trait loci (mQTLs) at PLEC CpGs in cartilage. The risk-conferring A allele of rs11780978 was found to correlate with decreased expression of PLEC, influencing OA-related pathways.
title: Multi-tissue epigenetic analysis of the osteoarthritis susceptibility locus mapping to the plectin gene PLEC

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was found to be associated with increased risks of colorectal and prostate cancer. It resided in a TCF binding site and was shown to enhance the binding affinity to the transcription factor TCF7L2. Experimental studies utilizing a c-Myc-335 luciferase reporter in LS174T colorectal cancer cells demonstrated that RNA interference targeting TCF7L2, CDX1, and CDX2 reduced the reporter's activity, indicating that these transcription factors were critical for the regulation of the c-Myc enhancer driven by Wnt signaling.
title: Wnt-responsive enhancer regulation in mammals by a CDX/TCF transcription factor collective and a novel DNA sequence motif

finding: The SNP rs1296028 was identified to affect the expression of lysosomal protease Cathepsin B (CTSB) in cis, as well as the expression of 16 genes in trans in CG macrophages. It was associated with susceptibility to Parkinson's disease and demonstrated strong evidence of shared causal variants in relevant gene networks.
title: Tensor Decomposition of Stimulated Monocyte and Macrophage Gene Expression Profiles Identifies Neurodegenerative Disease-specific Trans-eQTLs

finding: The SNP rs9331896 was shown to be a trans-eQTL associated with a component of 38 genes responsive to IFN-gamma in Alzheimer's disease. It also showed significant associations in the context of the complement pathway, implicating its role in disease etiology.
title: Tensor Decomposition of Stimulated Monocyte and Macrophage Gene Expression Profiles Identifies Neurodegenerative Disease-specific Trans-eQTLs

finding: The SNP rs298619 demonstrated a highly significant association in the GWAS for the schizophrenia latent variable, with a P value of 4.7 x 10-10, suggesting its relevance in the shared genetic factors between the disorder and MRI phenotypes.
title: Linking the genetic structure of neuroanatomical phenotypes with psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs2071518 showed associations with two traits in contrary directions, particularly in the context of blood pressure phenotypes.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis with IHT

finding: This SNP was associated with increased transcript levels of DDHD2 in both fetal and adult cortical tissues, indicating its stable regulatory impact relevant for ASD.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: The rs6988698 SNP was found to have strong evidence for selection, with a frequency of 75% in the Turkana population compared to an average minor allele frequency of 2.66% outside of Africa. This indicated significant association with the STC1 regulatory region involved in adaptation to dehydration and metabolism of animal products.
title: Adaptations to water stress and pastoralism in the Turkana of northwest Kenya

finding: The rs10107949 SNP showed a significant correlation with urea levels in the Turkana individuals, with a beta value of 0.030 and p-value of 1.96×10^-2, suggesting its relevance in kidney function and stress response.
title: Adaptations to water stress and pastoralism in the Turkana of northwest Kenya

finding: The rs75070347 SNP also demonstrated a significant correlation with urea levels, having a beta of 0.040 and p-value of 9.23×10^-3, indicating its potential involvement in the regulation of kidney function under dehydration stress.
title: Adaptations to water stress and pastoralism in the Turkana of northwest Kenya

finding: The rs7012892 SNP was identified as having strong evidence for selection, similar to rs6988698 and rs6994711, and showed high frequency in the Turkana population, reflecting adaptation within this specific context.
title: Adaptations to water stress and pastoralism in the Turkana of northwest Kenya

finding: The rs6994711 SNP was part of the top three derived SNPs showing strong selection evidence with 84% frequency in the Turkana, near invariance outside of Africa, underscoring its role in adaptation related to pastoralism and kidney function.
title: Adaptations to water stress and pastoralism in the Turkana of northwest Kenya

finding: The SCZ-associated GWAS SNP rs2565064 (chr8: 27,327,841) was found to interact with the promoter of PNOC in neurons. PNOC was identified as the putative target gene for this SNP, which is primarily transcribed in the brain and spinal cord, and encodes a precursor for neuropeptides that play roles in memory, learning, and emotional regulation.
title: SnapHiC-G: identifying long-range enhancer-promoter interactions from single-cell Hi-C data via a global background model

finding: The SCZ-associated SNP rs28541694 (chr8: 27,462,008) interacted with the promoter of ZNF395 in astrocytes, identifying ZNF395 as the putative target gene for this interaction. ZNF395 is involved in inflammation and cancer progression and demonstrated upregulation in the SCZ network, indicating its relevance in neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: SnapHiC-G: identifying long-range enhancer-promoter interactions from single-cell Hi-C data via a global background model

finding: The SNP rs620513 registered significant expression related to the FGF20 gene in dopaminergic neurons, denoting its relevance in Parkinson's disease research.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, aging and disease

finding: The SNP rs9987289 demonstrated significant allele-specific binding for the transcription factor HNF4A in liver tissue, resulting in reduced expression of the eGene TNKS. This finding linked rs9987289 to liver metabolism and cholesterol levels.
title: Mechanisms of tissue-specific genetic regulation revealed by latent factors across eQTLs

finding: The variant rs7815797 was significantly associated with the abundance of the genus Bacteroides, highlighting its significance in the relationship between genetic predisposition and microbiota, which might influence colorectal cancer risk.
title: Gut microbiota composition in colorectal cancer patients is genetically regulated

finding: As another variant influencing the Bacteroides abundance, rs72691617 contributed to the understanding of how certain SNPs may alter microbiota composition and potentially affect colorectal cancer development.
title: Gut microbiota composition in colorectal cancer patients is genetically regulated

finding: Identified alongside other variants, rs7817574 had a notable association with Bacteroides, reinforcing the concept that this SNP plays a significant role in connecting genetic factors to microbiota and colorectal cancer.
title: Gut microbiota composition in colorectal cancer patients is genetically regulated

finding: This SNP was found to correlate with the abundance of Bacteroides, thus playing a role in potentially modifying colorectal cancer risk through its influence on the gut microbiome.
title: Gut microbiota composition in colorectal cancer patients is genetically regulated

finding: The most significant association with Akkermansia abundance was linked to rs4527077, indicating that this SNP's effect on microbiota could be critical in understanding colorectal cancer risk.
title: Gut microbiota composition in colorectal cancer patients is genetically regulated

finding: This SNP, in conjunction with rs4527077, showed a direct correlation with Akkermansia abundance, emphasizing its potential role in modulating microbial populations and CRC risk.
title: Gut microbiota composition in colorectal cancer patients is genetically regulated

finding: The SNP rs804279, located approximately 6 kb downstream of the transcription factor-coding gene GATA4, was replicated in many cohorts and linked to a higher risk of metabolic dysfunction in PCOS patients.
title: Brain-specific Gata4 downregulation in Greywick female mice models the metabolic subtype of polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The SNP rs3729853, located in the gene body of GATA4, particularly near the end of intron 5, was recently associated with both lean and overweight/obese subgroups within bodyweight-stratified cases of PCOS.
title: Brain-specific Gata4 downregulation in Greywick female mice models the metabolic subtype of polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The SNP rs10090341 was found to be significant in relation to gut inflammation and colorectal cancer development. Leon-Cabrera and colleagues in 2018 highlighted that deficiency in STAT1 signaling related to this SNP predisposed individuals to gut inflammation, prompting colorectal cancer development.
title: MetaFunc: Taxonomic and Functional Analyses of High Throughput Sequencing for Microbiomes

finding: rs2976388 was linked to PUD and was in high linkage disequilibrium with rs2294008. It was discovered to be associated with increased PSCA expression and decreased risk for PUD, indicating its role in the molecular mechanism related to Helicobacter pylori infection.
title: Genome-wide association study of gastrointestinal disorders reinforces the link between the digestive tract and the nervous system

finding: The SNP rs10105357 on chromosome 8p23.2 was found to be associated with stronger connectivity in the medial amygdala network. Specifically, individuals with two copies of the minor allele (G) demonstrated significantly higher prosocial behavior scores and greater expression of CSMD1 in the temporal cortex compared to those with one or no copies. This association was supported by a genome-wide significant result (beta=0.203, p=2.97×10−8) and indicates that this SNP may contribute positively to social competencies.
title: Genetic variation in CSMD1 affects amygdala connectivity and prosocial behavior

finding: The SNP rs9693089, located at the FAM167A locus, was identified as associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) risk. It was found to be within the active enhancer state of islet samples, indicative of its regulatory role in beta-cell function. This SNP was linked to very low-density lipoprotein (VLDL) synthesis, showing the chromatin features H3K4me3, H3K4me1, and H3K27ac, affirming its functional significance.
title: Integrating convolution and self-attention improves language model of human genome for interpreting non-coding regions at base-resolution

finding: The SNP rs896854 at the TP53INP1 locus was recognized for its association with lipid levels, showing nominal significance (p-value=2×10^-6) and later reaching genome-wide significance (p-value=1×10^-9). This SNP was identified as functional by LOGO, with one activated chromatin feature indicating its relevance to regulatory mechanisms in lipid metabolism.
title: Integrating convolution and self-attention improves language model of human genome for interpreting non-coding regions at base-resolution

finding: The SNP rs516946 at the ANK1 locus was consistently reported across multiple studies for correlating with decreased insulin levels and pancreatic islet cell dysfunction. LOGO marked it as functional due to one activated feature, underscoring its relevance to diabetes-related regulatory pathways.
title: Integrating convolution and self-attention improves language model of human genome for interpreting non-coding regions at base-resolution

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was identified as a functionally validated GWAS susceptibility SNP for colon and prostate cancer. It was observed that this SNP exhibited greater chromatin accessibility in COAD samples compared to KIRC samples, highlighting its significance in the context of cancer type-specific chromatin dynamics. Specifically, accessibility at this SNP was associated with increased accessibility at the MYC gene, including its promoter region, indicating a potential mechanistic link in the regulation of MYC in COAD.
title: The UCSC Xena platform for public and private cancer genomics data visualization and interpretation

finding: The SNP rs10100360 was linked to the study of ionophores as potential anticancer drugs and chemosensitizers. It specifically related to salinomycin's selective effect on cancer stem-like cells (CSCs) through the disruption of the Golgi apparatus, which is crucial in protein processing, glycosylation, and secretion. The findings highlighted the vulnerability of epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (EMT) cells, suggesting that targeting the Golgi apparatus could serve as a novel therapeutic approach against CSCs.
title: Salinomycin disturbs Golgi apparatus function and specifically affects cells in epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition

finding: The SNP rs1495741 in the NAT2 gene was significantly correlated with self-reported facial aging, providing insight into the genetic factors influencing skin fluorescence and aging.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: This sub-threshold SNP for the PR interval was located intronically to KLHL38 and showed looping to FBXO32, an E3 ubiquitin ligase involved in muscle atrophy.
title: Detailed Regulatory Interaction Map of the Human Heart Facilitates Gene Discovery for Cardiovascular Disease

finding: The variant rs8192327 was noted as a high PIP introgressed intronic variant in SFTPC, associated with FEV/FVC ratio, demonstrating the impact of introgressed variants on breathing-related traits.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: The study found that participants carrying the T allele at rs187974 had lower gray matter density (GMD) in the right insula compared to those with the CC genotype. Specifically, individuals in the high pain sensitivity group showed significantly reduced GMD, suggesting that this SNP is associated with pain sensitivity traits.
title: A Brain-Wide Genome-Wide Association Study of Candidate Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Structural and Functional Phenotypes of Pain Sensitivity

finding: Participants with the risky C allele at rs10504722 had lower GMD in the dorsal anterior insula (dAI), which was associated with high pain sensitivity. The p-value indicating significance was 0.0037.
title: A Brain-Wide Genome-Wide Association Study of Candidate Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Structural and Functional Phenotypes of Pain Sensitivity

finding: The analysis linked the A allele of rs16907751 to lower GMD in the dAI among individuals with high pain sensitivity, with a significant p-value of 0.0002, confirming its association with pain-related neuroanatomy.
title: A Brain-Wide Genome-Wide Association Study of Candidate Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Structural and Functional Phenotypes of Pain Sensitivity

finding: Carriers of the A allele at rs396760 displayed decreased GMD in the dAI within the high pain sensitivity group, with a significant p-value of 0.0101, indicating its relationship with pain perception.
title: A Brain-Wide Genome-Wide Association Study of Candidate Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Structural and Functional Phenotypes of Pain Sensitivity

finding: In the HDL analysis, the SNP rs17482753 was replicated with a PIP of 1.00, underscoring its significant association with HDL levels as determined by the BANNs analysis.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: The SNP rs10955960 was associated with the gene COL14A1 located on human chromosome 8. The homologous mouse fragment engaged in a cluster 5 DInt, which confirmed previous GWAS observations and supported its association with adipose tissue-related traits.
title: Genome-wide analysis of promoter contacts identifies novel regulators of late-stage adipogenesis

finding: The SNP rs10110422 was linked to targeting the Hippo pathway as a potential therapeutic strategy in breast cancer (BC). This SNP was identified as significant in the context of cancer biology and was discussed in the study published by Wu and Yang in 2018, highlighting its relevance in precision medicine approaches for BC.
title: OncoOmics approaches to reveal essential genes in breast cancer: a panoramic view from pathogenesis to precision medicine

finding: The analysis indicated that there was a selective sweep observed at the MCPH1 locus for the derived allele ‘C’ at rs930557, which showed a longer Extended Haplotype Homozygosity (EHH) compared to the ancestral allele ‘G’. This finding suggested a novel bifurcation due to a mutation that altered phylogenetic interpretations.
title: Focusing on human haplotype diversity in numerous individual genomes demonstrates an evolutional feature of each locus

finding: The SNP rs60298754 was identified as significant in a GWAS study related to Parkinson's Disease (PD). This finding was contextualized by its association with the MMP16 gene, which is involved in inflammation and tissue remodeling, and has been observed as downregulated in PD patients, indicating its potential role in the pathology of the disease.
title: The role of ADAR editing and nonsense-mediated decay in Parkinson’s Disease

finding: The study identified rs1047643 as a novel functional risk variant associated with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). This SNP displayed dynamic allelic imbalance (AI) in chromatin accessibility and allelic expression on the FDFT1 gene specifically in B cells. Quantitative analyses indicated that the T allele of rs1047643 conferred a higher level of chromatin accessibility and expression in activated B cells compared to the C allele, suggesting its role in B cell deregulation in SLE. The association of rs1047643 with SLE was statistically significant with an adjusted p-value of 0.02, although it did not reach significance after accounting for other GWAS SNPs.
title: STAT3-mediated allelic imbalance of novel genetic variant rs1047643 and B cell specific super-enhancer in association with systemic lupus erythematosus

finding: This EPHX2 SNP rs10090802 emerged as a significant genetic marker, particularly for its association with dinor-prostaglandin F2α and played a role in the hemolysis susceptibility of RBCs.
title: Ferroptosis regulates hemolysis in stored murine and human red blood cells

finding: SNP rs2954021 was associated with the TRIB1 gene, which showed an extremely high level of significance (p < 10-200) in relation to the TG/HDL phenotype, suggesting a robust link to lipid metabolism and leukocyte differentiation.
title: Mechanistic genotype-phenotype translation using hierarchical transformers

finding: The SNP rs2279590 was identified as a risk variant for pseudoexfoliation and Alzheimer's disease. It was found to lie within an enhancer element, influencing the expression of the genes clu, ephx2, and ptk2b. This discovery highlighted the mechanistic role that rs2279590 plays in the regulatory landscape associated with Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: CoMM-S2: a collaborative mixed model using summary statistics in transcriptome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs139799338 was located in the intronic region of the PKHD1L1 gene and demonstrated a strong negative association with the relative abundance of the genus Acinetobacter (p=4.82×10^-12). This locus was particularly notable for its associations with various metabolic traits, including tumor marker carbohydrate antigen 199 (p=0.006), glycine (p=0.01), vitamin A (p=0.01), beta-alanine (p=0.03), and cobalt (p=0.047). Additionally, the study highlighted the role of gender, as males with elevated testosterone showed increased Acinetobacter abundance, and females carrying genotype AA had a higher abundance compared to those with GA/GG.
title: Unraveling the impact of host genetics and factors on the urinary microbiome in a young population

finding: The SNP rs112875651 was linked to liver fat and demonstrated colocalisation with hyperlipidemia, confirming its involvement in lipid metabolism.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The study focused on the TaqMan genotyping assay designed for SNP rs10092491, where two probes were utilized, each targeting an allele. In a comparison of genotyping performances using CLEAR-dPCR and QX200-ddPCR, it was found that CLEAR-dPCR yielded a mean count ratio of 99.6%, indicating its higher accuracy compared to QX200-ddPCR, which had a mean count ratio of 104.9%. It was observed that for heterozygous samples, the positive droplet patterns produced by both channels showed almost equal counts, and the analysis illustrated that most positive signals did not overlap, consistent with expectations derived from Poisson statistics. Additionally, both platforms detected zero false positive signals in homozygous samples, affirming the reliability of the methods.
title: Lossless and Contamination-Free Digital PCR

finding: Found in an intergenic locus, this SNP overlapped with GWAS for dilated cardiomyopathy and the EchoGen study for cardiac structure and function. The alternative allele was linked to reduced H3K27ac peak height and reduced expression of MTSS1.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: This SNP was prioritized due to its association with the MTSS1 gene, which also connected to cardiac function through a chromatin loop with rs34866937.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: The SNP rs6983267, located at chromosome 8q24, was associated with colorectal cancer predisposition and was linked to enhanced Wnt signaling pathways. The study indicated that this SNP could potentially contribute to tumorigenesis by modifying Wnt signaling, which plays a significant role in cellular proliferation and cancer development.
title: Lineage-specific oncogenes drive growth of major forms of human cancer using common downstream mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs10101615 exhibited correlations with NDVI-based metrics for grape maturation, indicating its relevance in monitoring and potentially improving practices in viticulture.
title: Assessing the capacity of high-resolution commercial satellite imagery for grapevine downy mildew detection and surveillance in New York state

finding: The SNP rs10090292 was found to be associated with the regulation of tumor spheroid growth in the context of breast cancer metastasis to bone. Specifically, the study indicated that tumor spheroid evolution is significantly influenced by the microenvironment stiffness and bone cell signaling interactions.
title: A novel mechanobiological model of bone metastasis reveals that mechanical stimulation inhibits the pro-osteoclastogenic effects of breast cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs4875048 was associated with schizophrenia and was found in linkage disequilibrium with the top association signal at this locus, rs10552126. It was the top eQTL regulating the expression of the HERV ERVLE_8q24.3h, which was significantly downregulated in cases. Interestingly, the risk (A-) allele of rs4875048 was associated with an increased expression of this HERV.
title: Schizophrenia risk from locus-specific human endogenous retroviruses

finding: The SNP rs13266066 was significantly associated with the 'never smoked' phenotype in the Russian cohort, demonstrating replication of its notable nominal associations identified in the UK biobank.
title: Understanding Complex Trait Susceptibilities and Ethnical Diversity in a Sample of 4,145 Russians Through Analysis of Clinical and Genetic Data

finding: The SNP rs11781072 confirmed significant association with smoking status, exhibiting a high p-value and indicating its strong correlation within the smoking initiation locus.
title: Understanding Complex Trait Susceptibilities and Ethnical Diversity in a Sample of 4,145 Russians Through Analysis of Clinical and Genetic Data

finding: The SNP rs983309 in the PPP1R3B gene was highlighted as established for multiple glycaemic traits, including fasting insulin and 2-hour postprandial glucose.
title: Genetics of fasting indices of glucose homeostasis using GWIS unravels tight relationships with inflammatory markers

finding: The SNP rs2126259 was noted for its strong association with glycaemic traits, including fasting glucose (FG), reinforcing the role of PPP1R3B in metabolic pathways.
title: Genetics of fasting indices of glucose homeostasis using GWIS unravels tight relationships with inflammatory markers

finding: The SNP rs11782386 showed robust associations with 2-hour postprandial glucose as part of the findings associated with PPP1R3B, indicating its importance in insulin-related traits.
title: Genetics of fasting indices of glucose homeostasis using GWIS unravels tight relationships with inflammatory markers

finding: The SNP rs13276086 was part of a haplotype in the TNKS region that showed strong signals of positive selection in the Kuwaiti population. It was associated with 17 phenotypic traits, including hypertension, and had a significant relationship with TNKS expression in the nervous system.
title: Genome-wide Selection Scan in an Arabian Peninsula Population Identifies a TNKS haplotype Linked to Metabolic Traits and Hypertension

finding: SNP rs9644677 was identified among 52 SNPs in the TNKS region showing signals of balancing selection according to the population analysis. This SNP was part of the seven SNPs under putative selection in the present study.
title: Genome-wide Selection Scan in an Arabian Peninsula Population Identifies a TNKS haplotype Linked to Metabolic Traits and Hypertension

finding: SNP rs13273033 was also among the 52 SNPs in the TNKS region identified for evidence of balancing selection, and it was included in the seven positively selected SNPs highlighted in the study.
title: Genome-wide Selection Scan in an Arabian Peninsula Population Identifies a TNKS haplotype Linked to Metabolic Traits and Hypertension

finding: SNP rs12545912 was included in the analysis of 52 SNPs that showed evidence of balancing selection within the TNKS region, and it was also one of the seven SNPs under positive selection in the current study.
title: Genome-wide Selection Scan in an Arabian Peninsula Population Identifies a TNKS haplotype Linked to Metabolic Traits and Hypertension

finding: At locus PLAT, rs1804182 was defined as an allelic enhancer variant that significantly altered enhancer activity depending on the allele.
title: Genome-wide discovery of SLE genetic risk variant allelic enhancer activity

finding: The SNP rs6983267, located at 8q24, was identified as a cancer risk variant that demonstrated a long-range interaction with the MYC oncogene in colorectal cancer. This finding established a link between the genetic variant and MYC, aligning with MYC's role in cancer progression, particularly highlighting the potential relevance of MYC in other cancer types such as prostate cancer.
title: MYC drives aggressive prostate cancer by disrupting transcriptional pause release at androgen receptor targets

finding: The variant rs16900241, located in the WASHC5 gene on chromosome 20, was associated positively with weight and negatively with body fat percentage. This finding marked an original observation as there were no prior studies linking WASHC5 to body composition traits, suggesting a unique role of this gene in regulating weight and fat distribution in populations such as the Malagasy.
title: Whole-genome Studies of Malagasy People Uncover Novel Body Composition Associations

finding: An exonic variant, rs10283100, was associated with the CV of the insula and is located in the gene ENPP2 at 8q24.12, indicating its potential role in influencing cortical volume measures.
title: Genetic Determinants of Cortical Structure (Thickness, Surface Area and Volumes) among Disease Free Adults in the CHARGE Consortium

finding: The rs1293298 variant in the CTSB locus was significantly associated with GBA penetrance in PD, showing a meta-P value of 6.34E-6 and an odds ratio of 0.725, indicating a genetic interaction with GBA variants that modulates PD risk.
title: Genetic modifiers of risk and age at onset in GBA associated Parkinson’s disease and Lewy body dementia

finding: The missense mutation rs74942016 in Nrg1, which resulted in a valine to leucine substitution at position 321 (V321L), was shown to be associated with schizophrenia and more strongly with psychosis in a Costa Rican population. This mutation impaired the cleavage of Nrg1 by gamma secretase, leading to reduced nuclear translocation of the Nrg1 intracellular domain (ICD). Such alterations were linked to disrupted signaling pathways that are critical for neurodevelopmental processes, indicating a convergence of rare and common variants on similar molecular phenotypes associated with schizophrenia.
title: Neuregulin1 nuclear signaling influences adult neurogenesis and regulates a schizophrenia susceptibility gene network within the mouse dentate gyrus

finding: The SNP rs79136984 highlighted in the RRM2B region underscored its role as a modifier effect, suggesting ongoing interactions influencing clinical outcomes.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The SNP rs117871919 was found in the gene SLC30A8, which encodes a zinc transporter protein expressed in pancreatic beta cells. This SNP had known associations with glycemic variance and control (namely HbA1c), BMI, and type 2 diabetes (T2D), all established risk factors for CVD, indicating that Delta ECG shares genetic signals not only with CVD but also with significant risk factors.
title: Genetic underpinnings of predicted changes in cardiovascular function using self supervised learning

finding: The SNP rs1562430 in CASC8 was associated with multiple cancer types and highlighted for its significant association with pancreatic cancer.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS assessment on genetic susceptibility to pancreatic cancer

finding: The SNP rs2392780 in CASC8 was noted for associations with breast cancer and referenced in the context of pancreatic cancer as well.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS assessment on genetic susceptibility to pancreatic cancer

finding: The SNP rs10625280, which maps to the SLC45A4 gene, was significantly associated with chronic pain intensity in the UK-Biobank study, showing a p-value of 1.21 x 10^-8. It was replicated in studies and demonstrated strong associations across diverse traits.
title: Identification of SLC45A4 as a pain gene encoding a neuronal polyamine transporter

finding: The missense variant rs3739238 (p.Asn718Asp) was significantly associated with pain intensity (p = 7.24 x 10^-9) and served as an eQTL for both SLC45A4 and DENND3 across multiple databases, highlighting its role in pain perception.
title: Identification of SLC45A4 as a pain gene encoding a neuronal polyamine transporter

finding: The A allele of the rs10505025 SNP was strongly associated with larger cross-sectional area (CSA) of fast-twitch muscle fibres in physically active men. Carriers of the AA genotype had higher mean CSA compared to G allele carriers, suggesting an association of this genetic variant with skeletal muscle hypertrophy and strength/power performance.
title: UBR5 is a Novel E3 Ubiquitin Ligase involved in Skeletal Muscle Hypertrophy and Recovery from Atrophy

finding: The A allele of the rs4734621 SNP was found to be significantly associated with increased expression of the UBR5 gene. This allele was also over-represented in elite strength and power athletes as compared to endurance athletes, indicating a correlation with strength/power-related phenotypes.
title: UBR5 is a Novel E3 Ubiquitin Ligase involved in Skeletal Muscle Hypertrophy and Recovery from Atrophy

finding: The SNP rs55705857, found at 8q24.21, was associated with alterations in multiple FA measures, indicating its significant role in white matter variations.
title: Common genetic variation influencing human white matter microstructure

finding: The analysis associated rs7818560 with levels of miR-30d-5p and GLIS3 expression in individuals with different genotypes. Specifically, rs7818560 was shown to influence miRNA expression (mirQTL) and display a trans-eQTL effect for GLIS3 (ENSG00000107249). This finding supports the hypothesis of a genetic regulation model where the SNP is directly associated with both miRNA and target gene levels, providing insight into the genetic basis underlying the expression of miRNAs and their target genes.
title: Noncanonical targeting contributes significantly to miRNA-mediated regulation

finding: The SNP rs7005905 was found to be in strong positive linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs7836366 and rs10100209, reinforcing the association of SOX7 gene with autism spectrum disorder (ASD). This SNP's context in strong LD supported the identification of the autism-associated gene SOX7.
title: SOX7: Novel Autistic Gene Identified by Analysis of Multi-Omics Data
