This original finding was significant for understanding the genetic basis of glioma and contributed to the broader landscape of cancer genomics.
title: Advanced image generation for cancer using diffusion models

finding: At the NRG1 locus, rs16879552 was found to be significantly associated with HSCR in European ancestry, presenting an OR of 1.9 (P=2.7×10^-6) with allele frequencies of 5% in cases vs. 3% in controls.
title: Multiple, independent, common variants overlapping known and putative gut enhancers at RET, SEMA3 and NRG1 underlie Hirschsprung disease risk in European ancestry subjects

finding: The variant rs16879576 also showed association with HSCR, characterized by an OR of 2.3 (P=7.2×10^-9) in cases with allele frequencies of 5% compared to 2% in controls.
title: Multiple, independent, common variants overlapping known and putative gut enhancers at RET, SEMA3 and NRG1 underlie Hirschsprung disease risk in European ancestry subjects

finding: The SNP rs75463553 at the PSKH2 locus showed a robust significant association (p = 8.4 x 10^-9) with the variance in FV plasma levels, despite not being associated with mean FV levels (p = 0.49). This SNP was also found to interact with GRIN2A and POM121L12, both associated with smoking biology.
title: A genome wide search for non-additive allele effects identifies PSKH2 as involved in the variability of Factor V activity

finding: The variant rs10090316 was associated with the extracellular matrix's impact on pancreatic cancer, suggesting a relationship with tumor progression and metastasis. This finding was contextually significant, highlighting how genetic factors could influence the characteristics of the tumor microenvironment and its interaction with cancer cells.
title: Small extracellular vesicles promote stiffness-mediated metastasis

finding: The findings for rs7826035 illustrated a scenario of parent-of-origin effects in tongue epithelial cells, as verified by methylation studies in family trios. Specifically, the unmethylated fragments strictly correlated with the paternal genotype, suggesting maternal-specific methylation characteristics in the context of family-based genetic analysis.
title: Atlas of imprinted and allele-specific DNA methylation in the human body

finding: The mapping of paddy rice using a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) by Zhang et al. (2018) involved SNP rs10111840 and utilized Landsat 8 datasets.
title: Influence of Temperate Forest Autumn Leaf Phenology on Segmentation of Tree Species from UAV Imagery Using Deep Learning

finding: The SNP rs7012446 was associated with LVESV (P = 1.5E-06), showing weak correlation with the RVESV lead SNP rs34015932, indicating shared but distinct genetic influences on right and left ventricular volumes.
title: Genetic Analysis of Right Heart Structure and Function in 40,000 People

finding: The SNP rs34015932 was reported to be the lead SNP for RVESV, with a significant association (P = 4.1E-08), and indicated allelic heterogeneity at the GATA4/CTSB locus.
title: Genetic Analysis of Right Heart Structure and Function in 40,000 People

finding: The study found that the C allele at rs2294008 was associated with a low risk of gastric cancer. This allele contributed to the C-C-A haplotype, which underwent positive selection primarily in Asian populations.
title: Spatial and temporal diversity of positive selection on shared haplotypes at the PSCA locus among worldwide human populations

finding: The C allele at rs2976391 is part of the C-A-G haplotype, which also carried a low risk of gastric cancer. The positive selection at this locus was observed in African populations.
title: Spatial and temporal diversity of positive selection on shared haplotypes at the PSCA locus among worldwide human populations

finding: The A allele at rs2978983 is linked with the C-A-G haplotype associated with low gastric cancer risk in African populations. This SNP is integral to the haplotypes that underwent positive selection.
title: Spatial and temporal diversity of positive selection on shared haplotypes at the PSCA locus among worldwide human populations

finding: The SNP rs74402157 located within CSMD1 showed a significant association (p<0.001) with earlier AAO, reinforcing the role of immune-related genes in the context of multiple sclerosis.
title: A higher burden of multiple sclerosis genetic risk confers an earlier onset

finding: The SNP rs56013326 was associated with aortic length, arch width, and aortic diameter, and three variants associated with this SNP overlapped with histone modification regions indicating potential regulatory effects.
title: Thoracic Aortic 3-Dimensional Geometry: Effects of Aging and Genetic Determinants

finding: The SNP rs138693040 located in the KCNQ3 gene was associated with variation in the electrocardiographic QT interval. This finding was significant and highlighted the influence of M-current modulators on cardiac physiology through their effects on sympathetic nervous system activity.
title: Novel target identification using single cell sequencing and electrophysiology of cardiac sympathetic neurons in disease

finding: The SNP rs13265509 presented a noteworthy GxS interaction (p=1.1×10−7) located between IDO2 and C8orf4, implicating differential effects on SCZ risk by sex.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: The rs12541643 was identified as the reported causal variant in the chr8:80998464-81093464 locus associated with fasting glucose (FG) levels and colocalized with a unique egQTL for TPD52 in fetal-like iPSC-PPCs, suggesting a role in glucose metabolism during development.
title: eQTL mapping in fetal-like pancreatic progenitor cells reveals early developmental insights into diabetes risk

finding: The rs12549167, located at chr8:81078464, was identified as the most likely candidate causal variant influencing TPD52 expression in fetal-like iPSC-PPCs, further linking it to fasting glucose association.
title: eQTL mapping in fetal-like pancreatic progenitor cells reveals early developmental insights into diabetes risk

finding: The SNP rs10110402 was identified as having positive and original findings as it was linked to calcium-independent effects of Orai1 in the dissemination of non-Hodgkin B cell lymphoma. This communicated the importance of Orai1 in lymphocyte movement and cancer progression.
title: Blocking Orai1 constitutive activity inhibits B-cell cancer migration and synergistically acts with drugs to reduce B-CLL cell survival

finding: The newly identified SNP rs2954021 at locus 8q24.1 was predictive of serum serine levels and implicated in MacTel risk through metabolic pathways.
title: Genetic Disruption of Serine Biosynthesis is a Key Driver of Macular Telangiectasia Type 2 Etiology and Progression

finding: The presence of the SNP rs10090331 was associated with increased expression of TRPC6 channels, which were required for the proliferation, migration, and invasion of breast cancer cell lines. This finding emphasized the role of rs10090331 in modulating the surface exposure of ORAI1 and ORAI3, thus impacting the cellular mechanisms in breast cancer progression.
title: Enhancer-driven local 3D chromatin domain folding modulates transcription in human mammary tumor cells

finding: The SNP rs7982 showed significant association (p=1E-50) with the ASE of CLU, but exclusively in the temporal cortex (TC) and not in the other brain regions.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs4236673 was associated with the ASE of CLU, demonstrating a strong linkage to the gene with implications for its role in AD.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs10110440 was associated with the lncRNA UCA1, which was found to play a significant role in the epigenetic regulation of colorectal cancer (CRC). The study highlighted how UCA1 influences the stem cell phenotype within CRC cells, particularly in CRISPR/Cas9 HT29-derived models. Loss of UCA1, which this SNP was linked to, resulted in an increased stem-cell phenotype, showcasing the complex role of this SNP in modulating cancer stem cell properties.
title: Long non-coding RNA UCA1 affects chromatin remodeling via SMARCA2-containing SWI/SNF complex in human colorectal cancer

finding: The rs118031911/T variant, a nonsense mutation causing a premature stop codon in the RP1 gene, was characterized as almost polymorphic in Japan with a frequency of 0.6% in the general population. Despite its benign nature in homozygous or heterozygous states, it exhibited significant enrichment in hereditary retinal degeneration (HRD) patients at a frequency of 2.1%. This represented a 3.5-fold increase compared to controls, indicating potential pathogenic implications when combined with other genetic variants, especially in the context of oligogenic inheritance patterns involving additional alleles from the EYS gene.
title: A frequent variant in the Japanese population determines quasi-Mendelian inheritance of rare retinal ciliopathy

finding: DeepSNP rs7839671 on chromosome 8 was identified as significantly linked to major depressive disorder (MDD), influencing the expression of the risk gene MEF2C and suggesting its role in MDD pathophysiology.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: SNP rs10099827, a proxy for rs7839671, exhibited meQTL effects on methylation linked to the regulation of gene activity related to MDD.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: rs58169119 was noted as an additional rare protective variant in the LLFS study, located in an intergenic region on chromosome 8. Carriers of the rare allele were associated with an average increase of 28 points in DSST, demonstrating its significant positive impact on processing speed.
title: Rare Genetic Variants Correlate with Better Processing Speed

finding: The SNP rs10100360 was linked to the study of ionophores in the context of their potential use as anticancer drugs and chemosensitizers. This research was published by Kaushik et al. in 2018, highlighting the relevance of ionophores in altering cellular ion gradients, which could impact membrane potential (MP) in various cell types, including bacteria.
title: Towards optical measurements of membrane potential values in Bacillus subtilis using fluorescence lifetime

finding: The PLAT SNP rs763007802 was predicted to create a 3 codons uORF by introducing a uAUG in the 5'UTR of the transcript NM_000930.5. However, there was no evidence of this variant impacting protein levels, rendering it unlikely to be causal in relation to VT due to its small uORF length and lower potential for biological impact.
title: MORFEE: a new tool for detecting and annotating single nucleotide variants creating premature ATG codons from VCF files

finding: The CTSB rs12898 polymorphism was found to be associated with primary hepatic cancer in a Chinese population. Although the specific context related to endometrial cancer wasn't directly mentioned, the SNP's connection to cancer indicates its potential relevance in cancer research.
title: Pattern Recognition Receptor based Prognostic Biomarkers for predicting Survival of Uterine Corpus Endometrial Cancer Patients

finding: The SNP rs11986220 was identified as a novel eQTL for the oncogenic gene MYC in prostate cancer samples with higher DNA methylation at a specific CpG site located approximately 10 kbp upstream of the MYC promoter. The study demonstrated that increased methylation at this site inhibited CTCF binding and prevented the formation of chromatin loops, thereby disrupting long-range interactions between this SNP and the MYC gene.
title: memo-eQTL: DNA methylation modulated genetic variant effect on gene transcriptional regulation

finding: The SNP rs1078141 was identified as a genome-wide significant SNP for pure happiness in a GWAS-by-subtraction method, which accounted for depressive symptoms. It was linked with a positive effect size of 0.102 and a very low p-value of 1.03×10^-8. This SNP's effect was consistent with a prior study by Baselmans and Bartels (2018) which reported a similar genetic association with general cognitive ability.
title: Distinguishing Happiness and Meaning in Life from Depressive Symptoms: a GWAS-by-subtraction study in the UK Biobank

finding: SNP rs1400506 was a lead SNP in a caQTL observed for the same lincRNA gene AC023095.1, further supporting its role in chromatin accessibility and gene expression in the type 1 cluster.
title: Population-scale skeletal muscle single-nucleus multi-omic profiling reveals extensive context specific genetic regulation

finding: The SNP rs7006037 was found to colocalize with caQTL signals for the AC023095.1 gene, indicating a significant role in chromatin regulation and gene expression within the type 1 muscle fiber cell context.
title: Population-scale skeletal muscle single-nucleus multi-omic profiling reveals extensive context specific genetic regulation

finding: The SNP rs6605578 was identified as interacting with the gene DEFA3, which is highly expressed in neutrophils. This interaction exhibited a high 3DFunc score, indicating a significant relationship in the context of Myelodysplastic Syndrome (MDS) and its association with disease risk.
title: A 3D genome atlas of genetic variants and their pathological effects

finding: The SNP rs7814783 was found to interact with the DEFA3 gene, which is important in neutrophil function. This was part of a set of interactions showing high 3DFunc scores, reinforcing its relevance to the pathogenesis of Myelodysplastic Syndrome (MDS) and potentially contributing to disease risk.
title: A 3D genome atlas of genetic variants and their pathological effects

finding: The SNP rs2738144 was documented to interact with the DEFA3 gene and demonstrated a high 3DFunc score. This finding supported its involvement in the progression of Myelodysplastic Syndrome (MDS) through significant transcriptional regulation effects.
title: A 3D genome atlas of genetic variants and their pathological effects

finding: This SNP was linked with histone modifications related to CLU, another gene implicated in Alzheimer's pathology.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs1532278 SNP provided regulatory evidence associated with CLU's promoter flanking regions, indicating its importance in Alzheimer’s disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP was associated with evidence of open chromatin for the CLU gene, further linking it to Alzheimer's disease mechanisms.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs9331888 SNP was linked to promoter flanking regions of CLU, reinforcing its association with risk factors for AD.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The minor allele (rs4841132-A) at chromosome 8p23.1 was significantly associated with an insulin resistance phenotype including increased fasting glucose, insulin levels, triglycerides, and waist-hip ratio. It was shown that the lncRNA LOC157273, where this SNP is located, acts as a negative regulator of PPP1R3B, influencing glycogen deposition in hepatocytes. The A allele was correlated with decreased LOC157273 levels, increased PPP1R3B expression, and increased glycogen deposition, which supports its role as a causal genetic factor in type 2 diabetes (T2D) risk.
title: A long noncoding RNA, LOC157273, is the effector transcript at the chromosome 8p23.1-PPP1R3B metabolic traits and type 2 diabetes risk locus

finding: The rs587776650 variant in the NBN gene was associated with Nijmegen breakage syndrome (NBS), known for significantly higher prevalence in Poland. The study reported its frequency in the Polish cohort as 0.27%, which stood in contrast to the global MAF of 0.04%.
title: ‘The Thousand Polish Genomes Project’ - a national database of Polish variant allele frequencies

finding: This genetic variant disrupted a stop codon in the MSR1 gene, leading to an elongated protein with added arginine (Arg). It was relevant to transferrin glycosylation.
title: Same role but different actors: genetic regulation of post-translational modification of two distinct proteins

finding: The intergenic variant rs3849810 also emerged in the GWAS for distressing psychotic experiences, exhibiting an odds ratio (OR=1.22) and a significant p-value (p=4.55×10^-8), suggesting its potential relevance to distressing symptoms associated with psychotic experiences.
title: Genetic association study of psychotic experiences in UK Biobank

finding: The rs35447033 variant in the NRG1 gene was significantly associated with the apnea-hypopnea index (AHI) in individuals of European ancestry, yielding a combined p-value of 3.02 × 10^-9. This association linked NRG1 to lung development and processes impacting sleep apnea.
title: Whole-Genome Association Analyses of Sleep-disordered Breathing Phenotypes in the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: The SNP rs7827317 was associated with the TRAPPC9 gene, demonstrating a consistent link to ADHD risk in the conducted analysis. Validation in Drosophila showed that TRAPPC9 knockdown in circadian neurons resulted in increased locomotor activity and reduced sleep, aligning with ADHD-related phenotypes.
title: Intellectual Disability-related genes increase ADHD risk and locomotor activity in Drosophila

finding: The SNP rs1030431 was significantly associated with gall bladder diseases and lipid metabolism traits, showing its potential relevance in lipid-related health outcomes.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: The SNP rs1805874, located in the Calbindin1 gene, was found to be associated with Parkinson's Disease (PD) in a study of Han Chinese populations. This association highlighted a potential genetic contribution to the disease, corroborating the hypothesis that variations in the Calbindin1 gene may influence disease susceptibility and progression.
title: Synaptic dysfunction and dysregulation of extracellular matrix-related genes in dopaminergic neurons derived from Parkinson’s disease sporadic patients and with GBA1 mutations

finding: The SNP rs596038 was identified on chromosome 7 and explained 9.51% of the variation in tuber flesh color at Godet. The homozygous AA accessions at this locus had a significantly higher proportion of genotypes with white flesh color compared to the heterozygous AG accessions. It was annotated as intergenic between the genes Dioal.07G046300 and Dioal.07G046200, related to calcium-binding and auxin-binding properties.
title: Genome-wide association studies reveal novel loci controlling tuber flesh color and oxidative browning in Dioscorea alata

finding: The study referenced in the context found an association between the TRIB1 gene rs17321515 A>G polymorphism and serum lipid levels in different populations. This relationship suggested that genetic variations in the TRIB1 gene could influence cardiovascular disease risk factors, particularly through their effects on serum lipids.
title: HEPG2 EXPRESSION OF MIR-202 & TRIB-1 UNDER METABOLIC AND INFLAMMATORY STRESS

finding: NDUFAF6-rs10098778 was confirmed to have a suggestive signal associated with LOAD in the meta-analysis of the GR@ACE dataset combined with IGAP stages I and II, with an odds ratio of 1.06 and a p-value of 2.54 x 10^-8. This finding was previously indicated in other studies but reiterated in this analysis.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of dementia and its clinical endophenotypes reveal novel loci associated with Alzheimer’s disease and three causality networks of AD: the GR@ACE project

finding: The variant rs6983267 was identified as a risk variant in a transcriptional enhancer, demonstrating long-range interaction with the MYC gene in colorectal cancer. This finding highlighted the crucial role of noncoding variants in gene regulation and their involvement in tumorigenesis.
title: In silico generation and augmentation of regulatory variants from massively parallel reporter assay using conditional variational autoencoder

finding: The missense variant rs34173062 in the SHARPIN gene was found to modify a data-driven MRI feature associated with brain atrophy in Alzheimer's disease (AD). In a study involving the AD Neuroimaging Initiative dataset with 1,100 subjects, this SNP showed genome-wide significance (p=2.1×10-10) in relation to the medial temporal circuit (MTC) volume across various diagnosis groups. When replicated in the UK Biobank dataset (n=8,428), this SNP was associated with reduced cortical thickness in the left (p=0.002) and right (p=8.6×10-4) entorhinal cortices, both regions critical to AD pathology. Moreover, the rs34173062-A risk allele correlated significantly with a parental history of AD, indicating its role in the heritable component of the disease (meta-analysis p=2.3×10-6), thereby reinforcing its involvement in AD pathways.
title: A Non-Synonymous SHARPIN Variant is Associated with Limbic Degeneration and Family History of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Carriers of the rs9987289 SNP had higher liver PPP1R3B expression, which was associated with elevated fasting glucose, lower plasma lipids, and increased liver enzymes ALT and ALP. This SNP was identified as a liver expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for PPP1R3B, linking higher expression to the reported traits.
title: PPP1R3B is a metabolic switch that shifts hepatic energy storage from lipid to glycogen

finding: Heterozygous carriers of rs4240624 exhibited increased ALT levels but decreased hepatic fat, consistent with findings that overexpression of PPP1R3B leads to increased glycogen storage and altered metabolic profiles, mirroring mouse model results.
title: PPP1R3B is a metabolic switch that shifts hepatic energy storage from lipid to glycogen

finding: Similar to rs4240624, heterozygous carriers of rs4841132 also showed elevated plasma glucose and significantly reduced plasma lipids and ketones compared to non-carriers. This further correlated with the physiological effects observed in the mouse models regarding PPP1R3B expression and its metabolic consequences.
title: PPP1R3B is a metabolic switch that shifts hepatic energy storage from lipid to glycogen

finding: Huang et al. (2018) assessed forest above-ground biomass estimation successfully using multi-temporal C-band Sentinel-1 and polarimetric L-band PALSAR-2 data, highlighting data integration's effectiveness.
title: Using hypertemporal Sentinel-1 data to predict forest growing stock volume

finding: The SNP rs11781321 was identified as an intronic variant within ATP6V0D2, and lower levels of this gene were observed in Ldlr knockout mice with lower LDL levels, suggesting its potential role in lipid metabolism.
title: Genetically regulated gene expression underlies lipid traits in Hispanic cohorts

finding: In the Combined sample, SNP rs72728755 achieved genome-wide significance for orofacial cleft risk with a p-value of 9.35E-14 and an odds ratio of 2.13 (95% CI = [1.74–2.62]). It was the only SNP reported in this manner across the analyzed populations.
title: Whole genome sequencing of orofacial cleft trios from the Gabriella Miller Kids First Pediatric Research Consortium identifies a new locus on chromosome 21

finding: SNP rs55658222 was identified as the lead SNP in the 8q24.21 region, which has been implicated in nearly all previous orofacial cleft studies among individuals of European ancestry. This SNP showed significant association but its exact p-value was not provided.
title: Whole genome sequencing of orofacial cleft trios from the Gabriella Miller Kids First Pediatric Research Consortium identifies a new locus on chromosome 21

finding: SNP rs987525 was in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs55658222 and had been the lead SNP in previous GWAS studies of orofacial clefts among European samples. It showed modest evidence of association in the Colombian trios with a p-value of 8.609e-06 and an odds ratio of 1.984 (95% CI = [1.46–2.69]).
title: Whole genome sequencing of orofacial cleft trios from the Gabriella Miller Kids First Pediatric Research Consortium identifies a new locus on chromosome 21

finding: The SNP rs10090316 was associated with the extracellular matrix's role in pancreatic cancer, as highlighted in the context of the study by Weniger et al. This SNP demonstrated significant relevance due to its involvement in the complex interplay between tumor cells and the stroma, particularly in the context of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC). The findings indicated that alterations at this locus could be correlated with inflammation and the bioengineering of the cancer microenvironment.
title: 3D in vitro modeling of the exocrine pancreatic unit using tomographic volumetric bioprinting

finding: The SNP rs10100342 was originally found to be associated with HER2-positive breast cancer (BC) responses to therapies targeting HER2. The findings indicated that variation at this SNP could influence the effectiveness of trastuzumab and pertuzumab treatments in HER2-positive BC patients. This SNP was linked to considerations of resistance mechanisms, particularly in relation to hypoxia inducible factor-1 alpha (HIF-1α) accumulation, which was noted to contribute to resistance in HER2+ BC cells.
title: Mammalian orthoreovirus infection in human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 positive (HER2+) breast cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs10111686 was related to a study that highlighted how vegetation indices did not adequately capture the variation in forest cover within upland Siberian larch forests. This indicated a significant limitation in using standard vegetation indices for specific forest types.
title: Pixel walking along the boreal forest–Arctic tundra ecotone: Large scale ground-truthing of satellite-derived greenness (NDVI)

finding: The SNP rs28513081 was a candidate located in an intron of the DEPTOR gene. It was associated with decreased expression of DEPTOR in colon, lung, and skin. The fine-mapping analysis revealed multiple variants within DEPTOR contributing to IPF risk and highlighted its potential significance in the disease.
title: Genome-wide association study of susceptibility to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: rs3808619, an hQTL variant correlated with rs4739134, produced a strong emVar effect with the alternate C allele resulting in an AE with FC of 2.11 and FDR q-value of 0.0008, positioning it as a candidate causal variant for SLE influencing IL7 gene expression.
title: Massively Parallel Reporter Assay Confirms Regulatory Potential of hQTLs and Reveals Important Variants in Lupus and Other Autoimmune Diseases

finding: The rs907183 SNP was found in a regulatory region with significance for Barrett's oesophagus. It was expected to interfere with the binding of transcriptional activators, which suggests a role in the disease development pathway.
title: The metaplastic precursor state to oesophageal adenocarcinoma represents reversion to a transient epithelial cell state in the developing oesophagus

finding: The SNP rs804270 in the NEIL2 gene was specifically examined in the context of gastric cancer (GC). The study reported that this genetic variation was associated with the risk of developing GC based on gene expression profiles in gastric specimens. The findings suggested that down-regulation of NEIL2 related to this SNP contributed to the accumulation of oxidative DNA damage and facilitated the progression of GC in patients who were infected with Helicobacter pylori.
title: NEIL2 plays a critical role in limiting inflammation and preserving genomic integrity in H. pylori-infected gastric epithelial cells

finding: The noncoding variant rs2441850 near the RIMS2 gene was associated with sucralose bitterness ratings, achieving genome-wide significance, indicating its role in altering sweetness perception related to bitterness.
title: Worldwide study of the taste of bitter medicines and their modifiers

finding: The SNP rs147998249 was associated with alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels and had a significant association value (P=2.35×10−60). It indicated that there were multiple functional coding rare variants in the gene GPT, suggesting a strong role of this gene in liver-related phenotypes.
title: Loss-of-function genomic variants with impact on liver-related blood traits highlight potential therapeutic targets for cardiovascular disease

finding: The SNP rs10503253 was associated with the gene CSMD1, which showed relevance in the context of schizophrenia risk. It was noted that this specific variant had neuropsychological effects, demonstrating a connection to intellectual disability and related disorders.
title: De novo variants in population constrained fetal brain enhancers and intellectual disability

finding: The rs2280838-T haplotype was found to be positively associated with increased SLC39A4 transcript levels in liver tissue, as demonstrated through targeted DAF-seq. This locus mediated transcriptional actuation of the SLC39A4 promoter, with 72% of reads from actively expressed chromatin originating from the rs2280838-T allele. The study suggested that differences in chromatin architecture and nucleosome occupancy modulated by the rs2280838 variant play a crucial role in the mechanistic link between this SNP and the expression of SLC39A4, relevant to conditions like acrodermatitis enteropathica.
title: Deaminase-assisted single-molecule and single-cell chromatin fiber sequencing

finding: At the TOX locus, rs1947178 was identified as the lead variant, which increased chromatin accessibility and was co-accessible with the TOX promoter, linking it to T1D risk.
title: Single-cell gene expression and chromatin accessibility profiling of human pancreatic islets at basal and stimulatory conditions nominates mechanisms of type 1 diabetes genetic risk

finding: The TSP rs1839333 was significantly associated with uric acid levels in multiple GWAS, with a p-value less than 2E-18. This SNP was also related to gout, although its association did not meet the strict significance threshold.
title: Diverse functions associate with trans-species polymorphisms in humans

finding: Like rs1839333, this TSP was significantly associated with uric acid levels with a p-value under 2E-18 across various populations. It was also involved in associations with body mass traits, indicating its potential role in metabolism.
title: Diverse functions associate with trans-species polymorphisms in humans

finding: This variant was illustrated to be associated with pancreatic cancer, with a p-value of 7E-10, and was mentioned to be in high LD with the TSPs on 8q21.11.
title: Diverse functions associate with trans-species polymorphisms in humans

finding: The SNP rs2293855 in the MTMR9 gene was associated with glucose tolerance, insulin secretion, insulin sensitivity, and an increased risk of prediabetes. This finding provided significant insight into the genetic factors influencing metabolic traits.
title: Developmental transcriptomic analysis of the cave-dwelling crustacean, Asellus aquaticus

finding: The MMP16 rs60298754 polymorphism was associated with clinical phenotypes of Parkinson's disease among a Southern Chinese population.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The EPHX2 rs751141 SNP showed associations with diabetic nephropathy risk among Egyptian patients with type 2 diabetes.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The SNP rs10090297 was linked to findings in the context of the p53 pathway's influence on glioblastoma. Given the role of p53 in cellular responses to stress and apoptosis, this SNP could contribute to understanding how glioblastoma cells might resist conventional therapies, such as temozolomide, thus highlighting the interplay between genetic variants and treatment efficacy.
title: Cyclopamine sensitizes Glioblastoma cells to Temozolomide treatment through Sonic Hedgehog pathway

finding: The rs76094283 variant was suggested as the causal variant in the GFRA2 locus, showing high posterior probability of association with increased fat intake while reducing carbohydrate and protein intake. This variant was located in the transcription start site of GFRA2, which encodes a receptor important for neuron differentiation, highlighting its role in eating behavior.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association meta-analysis of dietary intake identifies new loci and genetic and functional links with metabolic traits

finding: SNP rs13250438 demonstrated significant allelic differences in both cell lines and was also an eQTL for certain genes in the DLPFC, indicating its importance in transcription regulation.
title: A screen of 1,049 schizophrenia and 30 Alzheimer’s-associated variants for regulatory potential

finding: The IL7 missense variant rs201412253 (Val18Ile) was associated with increased lymphocyte count in South Asians (p=4.4×10^-10) and significantly increased IL7 protein secretion in an engineered cellular model, linking it to blood-cell phenotype regulation.
title: Trans-ethnic and ancestry-specific blood-cell genetics in 746,667 individuals from 5 global populations

finding: The rs1293298 SNP, located in intron 1 of the CTSB gene, was identified as the top variant associated with Parkinson's disease (PD) risk in a GWAS analysis, having a p-value of 3.41E-16. This SNP exhibited a protective effect against PD and was linked to increased expression levels of CTSB in brain tissues relevant to PD, particularly in regions such as the basal ganglia, cortex, and nucleus accumbens. Additionally, fine mapping suggested that rs1293298 had the highest posterior probability (0.127) of being a causal variant influencing both PD risk and CTSB expression.
title: The Parkinson’s disease risk gene cathepsin B promotes fibrillar alpha-synuclein clearance, lysosomal function and glucocerebrosidase activity in dopaminergic neurons

finding: SNP rs148563140, located near the ZBTB10 locus on chromosome 8, reached genome-wide significance in patients with TGA, with an odds ratio of 3.42 (p=3.28×10−8).
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs143638934 near ZBTB10 on chromosome 8 demonstrated genome-wide significance in TGA patients with an odds ratio of 3.42 (p=3.51×10−8).
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: Variant rs2954658, identified within the RPL8 locus, was associated with increased gene expression. Editing Daudi cells confirmed a strong statistical effect of the T allele on RPL8 expression, demonstrating its likely role as a causal variant involved in B cell gene expression regulation.
title: Defining the function of disease variants with CRISPR editing and multimodal single cell sequencing

finding: This SNP was identified in a genome-wide association study involving the MA.27 trial and was associated with the breast cancer free interval. The variant SNP increased EGR1 binding to the LMTK3 promoter in response to androstenedione, and its expression pattern was reversible by aromatase inhibitor treatment, revealing its influence on LMTK3 regulation and ER-alpha expression.
title: MIR2052HG regulates ERα levels and aromatase inhibitor resistance through LMTK3 by recruiting EGR1

finding: Similar to rs4476990, this SNP was also a finding from the GWAS linked to the breast cancer free interval. It was associated with lower MIR2052HG and ER-alpha expression in the presence of aromatase inhibitors, indicating its role in regulating LMTK3 and ER-alpha levels in a SNP- and AI-dependent manner.
title: MIR2052HG regulates ERα levels and aromatase inhibitor resistance through LMTK3 by recruiting EGR1

finding: The finding related to SNP rs6983267 indicated that mice lacking a Myc enhancer, which included this SNP, were resistant to intestinal tumors. This demonstrated a clear association between the genetic modification at this locus and cancer resistance, suggesting that the presence of the SNP impacted Myc-related tumorigenesis.
title: Preventing cancer by long-term partial Myc suppression

finding: The PD risk allele rs2740595-C decreased expression of cathepsin B (CTSB), confirming its role as an eQTL affecting gene expression related to PD.
title: Discordant transcriptional signatures of mitochondrial genes in Parkinson’s disease human myeloid cells

finding: The PD risk allele rs2306528-T was associated with an exon skipping event in FAM49B, which is a novel regulator of mitochondrial function, highlighting its role in PD susceptibility through splicing regulation.
title: Discordant transcriptional signatures of mitochondrial genes in Parkinson’s disease human myeloid cells

finding: The genetic variant rs28396985, located in the intron of TSNARE1, was associated with a significant increase in expression of TSNARE1 when the G allele was present compared to the A allele. The findings were corroborated by both MPRAduo activity measurements, which revealed higher activity for the G allele, and eQTL analysis from GTEx demonstrating increased TSNARE1 expression in various tissues, including the cerebellum and spleen, indicating a strong in vivo effect. Additionally, this result aligned with the predicted REST delta-binding scores, which indicated a higher binding and regulatory potential for the G allele.
title: Whole genome functional characterization of RE1 silencers using a modified massively parallel reporter assay

finding: The study identified that the rs7014968 SNP in the XKR6 gene was associated with increased serum total cholesterol levels. This finding indicated a potential link between this SNP and an elevated risk of coronary heart disease and ischemic stroke.
title: A small H2O-soluble ingredient of royal jelly lower cholesterol levels in liver cells by suppressing squalene epoxidase

finding: rs3008282 was documented as a significant svQTL for RPL23AP53, with findings that suggested it was associated with higher expression of the main isoform RPL23AP53-203 in the context of its minor allele. This SNP also exhibited properties of an eQTL for the RPL23AP53 gene in other tissues.
title: Alternative splicing regulation by GWAS risk loci for breast cancer

finding: rs2906324 was identified as a significant svQTL associated with the RPL23AP53 isoforms. Similar to the other two SNPs at the same locus, the minor allele of rs2906324 was linked to enhanced expression of the prevalent isoform RPL23AP53-203, contributing to the risk of breast cancer.
title: Alternative splicing regulation by GWAS risk loci for breast cancer

finding: rs66823261 was found to be a significant svQTL affecting RPL23AP53 gene isoforms, specifically associated with increased expression of isoform RPL23AP53-203. It was linked to breast cancer risk, particularly in estrogen receptor-negative cases.
title: Alternative splicing regulation by GWAS risk loci for breast cancer

finding: The SNP rs7015630 was situated near the gene OSGIN2, which had no apparent functional links to inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and received a low network score of 43%. In contrast, the gene RIPK2, located 108 kb distal, had a high network score of 99% and was identified as a mediator of inflammatory signaling through its interaction with the bacterial sensor NOD2. This indicated that RIPK2 was a significant candidate gene for IBD, underscoring the SNP's relevance in identifying genes associated with this condition.
title: Network expansion of genetic associations defines a pleiotropy map of human cell biology

finding: The SNP rs6984305 on chromosome 8 was identified as having an overall genome-wide significant GxE effect involving HDL as the phenotype and alcohol consumption as the environmental factor. This SNP was also linked to a previous study that showed a GxE effect on HDL with sleep duration as the environmental factor. It was reported to be marginally associated with liver enzyme levels and serum alkaline phosphatase levels in the NHGRI-EBI GWAS catalog.
title: A two-step approach to testing overall effect of gene-environment interaction for multiple phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs3748136 was linked to blood reticulocyte counts, showing the A allele had an approximately 18-fold higher SuRE activity than the G allele, correlating with differential transcription factor binding.
title: Systematic identification of human SNPs affecting regulatory element activity

finding: The SNP rs4129585 was significantly associated with methylation changes at the differentially methylated position (DMP) cg00622907, which was located approximately 2500 base pairs near the <italic>TSNARE1</italic> gene. This association was observed in both individuals with psychosis risk syndrome (PRS) and patients with first-episode schizophrenia (FES). Particularly, this SNP was found within a CpG island in the gene body of <italic>TSNARE1</italic>, and the relevant DMPs were noted to exhibit profound hypomethylation characteristic of these psychiatric conditions.
title: Methylomic alteration in peripheral blood lymphocytes of prodromal stage and first-episode Chinese Han schizophrenia patients

finding: The SNP rs2954021, located in the TRIB1 gene, was found to predict both ALT and ALP, indicating its role in liver function and potential confounding effects in metabolic studies.
title: The effect of liver enzymes on body composition: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: rs189005747 was located at gene XKR4 and was associated with the strength of 1-day circadian periodicity, with a p-value of 9.9×10^-9. It had been previously linked to thyroid stimulating hormone and coronary artery disease.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: In a study conducted by Sur et al., it was found that mice lacking a Myc enhancer that includes the human SNP rs6983267 were resistant to intestinal tumors. This suggests that rs6983267 plays a significant role in tumorigenesis, particularly in the context of colorectal cancer, by influencing the activity of the MYC oncogene.
title: Discovery and Functional Characterization of Pro-growth Enhancers in Human Cancer Cells

finding: The ADRB3 rs4994 polymorphism was identified to increase the risk of childhood and adolescent overweight/obesity in East Asia, reflecting its influence on body weight regulation.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The variant rs3808619 was recognized as a PU.1 motif-altering SNP that showed a strong regulatory association with lymphocyte count, leading to the upregulation of the <ZC2HC1A> gene. It displayed significant enhancement of reporter activity in functional assays and corroborated findings regarding chromatin accessibility and active histone marks.
title: Colocalization of blood cell traits GWAS associations and variation in PU.1 genomic occupancy prioritizes causal noncoding regulatory variants

finding: The SNP rs142010226 was strongly associated (P < 10^-15) with HbA1c levels in the EXTEND human cohort, which included diabetic and non-diabetic individuals of European ancestry. This association indicated a potential role for SLC7A2 in glucose homeostasis, suggesting that this genetic variant may influence the regulation of SLC7A2 expression through the nearby transcription factors MAFB and FOXA2.
title: Pancreatic islet α cell function and proliferation requires the arginine transporter SLC7A2

finding: Similarly, SNP rs2517232 was also strongly associated (P < 10^-15) with HbA1c levels in the EXTEND human cohort. Like rs142010226, this SNP occurred within ~1 kb of binding sites for MAFB and FOXA2, reinforcing the hypothesis of SLC7A2's involvement in glucose homeostasis and how these genetic variants might regulate SLC7A2 expression in islets.
title: Pancreatic islet α cell function and proliferation requires the arginine transporter SLC7A2

finding: The SNP rs6651252 was linked to Crohn's disease and was reported to impact the expression of the MYC gene in human colonic epithelial cells. This finding underscored the SNP's relevance to inflammatory bowel diseases and provided insight into its potential influence on disease mechanisms.
title: Alternative paths to immune activation: the role of costimulatory risk genes for polygenic inflammatory disease in T helper cells

finding: The SNP rs715732 was linked to putamen volume variability. It explained 0.444% of the variance in the mean models and showed negligible mean variance contribution at 0.0028%.
title: Genetic control of variability in subcortical and intracranial volumes

finding: In the study, rs34034296 was identified as the most significant SNP associated with mathematical reasoning ability, with a p-value of 2.01×10−8. This SNP was part of seven genome-wide significant SNPs that were in high linkage disequilibrium, and mapped to an intergenic region near the gene CSMD3. CSMD3 has been previously implicated in neurodevelopmental disorders such as schizophrenia and autism, suggesting a direct link to mathematical ability.
title: A genome-wide association study identified new variants associated with mathematical abilities in Chinese children

finding: The SNP rs10090282 was associated with MCM10 expression and its role in promoting tumor progression in breast cancer. The study provided evidence that MCM10, which was upregulated in cancer stem-like cells (CSCs), played a critical role in compensating for DNA replication stress induced by c-Myc. High levels of MCM10 expression were linked to the drug resistance seen in CSCs, suggesting that targeting the c-Myc-MCM10 axis may help prevent drug resistance and tumor recurrence.
title: MCM10 compensates for Myc-induced DNA replication stress in breast cancer stem-like cells

finding: The SNP rs10110423 was linked to TGFβ imprinting during NK cell activation, which promoted cytokine hypersecretion. This highlighted its role in influencing NK cell behaviors that are critical in tumor immunity.
title: Identification of small molecule enhancers of NK cell tumoricidal activity via a tumor microenvironment-mimicking co-culture assay

finding: At the ZFPM2 locus, the lead SNP rs6993770 had substantial associations (meta-P-value = 4.73 × 10-8), correlating with traits related to platelets and immune function, confirming prior findings from GWAS on platelet traits.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs4736367 on the JRK gene demonstrated significant effects on gene expression as noted in the analyses involving both SH-SY5Y and microglia cells. This finding pointed towards its involvement in the genetic predisposition to alcohol use disorder.
title: Functional 3’-UTR Variants Identify Regulatory Mechanisms Impacting Alcohol Use Disorder and Related Traits

finding: The SNP rs3808607 displayed allelic heterogeneity influenced by both ancestry and environmental factors, highlighting its role in LDL cholesterol variation.
title: Accounting for heterogeneity due to environmental sources in meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs11778951 was established to influence the expression of ENPP2 in pDCs, with the G allele increasing ENPP2 expression. This SNP was located in a region with predicted binding sites for STAT3 and was relevant in understanding how increased interferon signaling in SLE patients could enhance ENPP2 expression.
title: Autotaxin may play a Critical Role between the Genetic Risk Factors and Pathogenesis of SLE in Plasmacytoid Dendritic Cells

finding: rs16897517 showed a significant association with nose and its adjacent region (p = 1.39 × 10^-11), influencing nostril shape, where TT alleles were linked with narrower and shorter nostrils. This SNP appeared to have a broader effect on the nasal region compared to others.
title: Genome-wide Association study of facial morphology identifies novel genetic loci in Han Chinese

finding: The SNP rs13266634, associated with the solute carrier family 30 member 8 (SLC30A8), was involved in significant findings linking it to type 2 diabetes and impaired glucose tolerance, as evidenced by a meta-analysis conducted by Xu et al. in 2011. This relationship highlighted the importance of zinc homeostasis in metabolic pathways that may contribute to lipid-related diseases.
title: The role of cation diffusion facilitator CDF-1 in lipid metabolism in Caenorhabditis elegans

finding: The SNP rs900776 was identified as a putative causal variant with a high posterior inclusion probability (PIP) of 0.99 when analyzed using the cross-population fine-mapping method XMAP. Prior analyses with SuSiE had shown a significantly lower PIP of 0.002 due to strong linkage disequilibrium in European populations. However, XMAP utilized data from both European and African populations, revealing that rs900776 had weaker correlations within the African population. This positional analysis underscored XMAP's improved power and resolution in detecting causal variants by leveraging genetic diversity.
title: XMAP: Cross-population fine-mapping by leveraging genetic diversity and accounting for confounding bias

finding: In chromosome 8, related to eating disorders (EAT), rs78958069 displayed a MAF of 0.0002, an Info value of 0.005, and a p-value of 4.17 × 10^-10, surpassing the default threshold.
title: DISTMIX2: robust imputation of summary statistics for cosmopolitan cohorts using a large and diverse reference panel

finding: The rare stop-gained variant rs756831345 on 8q was significantly associated with 8q CNN-LOH events, indicated by an odds ratio (OR) of 91 (95% confidence interval: 52-159) and a very low p-value of 9.8 x 10^-23. The association suggested that this variant duplicated the NBN risk allele, with a significance of p=0.00012, indicating its substantial role in the context of clonal hematopoiesis.
title: The genomic landscape of clonal hematopoiesis in Japan

finding: The C allele at rs78898975 in TATA-box binding protein associated factor 2 (TAF2) was significantly linked to an increased risk of therapy-related myeloid neoplasms (t-MDS), with an OR_meta of 5.87 (95% CI = 3.20, 10.76, P_meta=9.9×10^-9), but showed no association with de novo MDS (OR=1.8, P_meta=0.20). This indicates a specific risk associated with t-MDS rather than general MDS.
title: Genome-wide association analyses identify variants in IRF4 associated with acute myeloid leukemia and myelodysplastic syndrome susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was identified as a genomic variant located in the c-Myc-335 enhancer, which was found to upregulate MYC transcript levels through Wnt signaling and SOX9. This SNP was associated with an increased risk of colorectal cancer (CRC) in humans. The study demonstrated that both TCF7L2 and SOX9 were enriched at this enhancer in CRC cells, indicating a potential regulatory mechanism by which this SNP could contribute to Wnt signaling amplification in CRC.
title: SOX9 binds TCFs to mediate Wnt/β-catenin target gene activation

finding: Methionine sulfoxide reductase A polymorphism rs10903323 was associated with an increased risk of coronary artery disease, highlighting its role in cardiovascular health.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The EPHX2 SNP rs11780592 showed an association with oxidized LDL and mortality in patients with diabetic chronic kidney disease, highlighting its potential as a prognostic marker.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The rs12549902 variant demonstrated strong association with NKX6-3 expression in pancreatic islets, showing a negative correlation with T2D risk allele and high LD with rs33981001.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: This T2D-associated variant was identified at the same locus as rs33981001, showing high LD with the lead eQTL variant for ANK1 and significant positive effects on its expression.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: At the same locus as rs62508166, rs516946 was linked to increased expression of ANK1 in subcutaneous adipose tissue, associated with T2D risk.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was found to exhibit a long-range interaction with the MYC gene in colorectal cancer. Pomerantz et al. (2009) demonstrated that this variant was implicated in cancer susceptibility, emphasizing the role of noncoding regions in tumorigenesis.
title: Predicting the effects of SNPs on transcription factor binding affinity

finding: The SNP rs10957311 was associated with LRP10, showing increased expression levels in CD14+ monocytes and pseudobulk PBMCs with higher minor allele count, but had an opposite effect in B cells.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs4840568 was found to overlap with chromatin accessible in B/plasma cells and associated with the BLK gene. Its significance in the context of RA was reinforced by a Wilcoxon test indicating strong evidence for its pathogenic role.
title: The Chromatin Landscape of Pathogenic Transcriptional Cell States in Rheumatoid Arthritis

finding: In the African American (AA) population, rs146535276 was associated with a non-responder phenotype, where carriers showed an average delta systolic blood pressure change of -2 mmHg, in contrast to 15 mmHg seen in non-carriers. This SNP was located in a region previously linked to various blood pressure phenotypes.
title: Rapid response to the Alpha-1 Adrenergic Agent Phenylephrine in the Perioperative Period is Impacted by Genomics and Ancestry

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was identified as a cancer risk variant located at 8q24, notably exhibiting an association with colorectal cancer. The original finding highlighted its long-range interaction with the MYC oncogene, implicating regulatory mechanisms in cancer development. This finding underscored the significance of non-coding SNPs in mediating genetic risks related to cancer.
title: Quantifying the impact of genetically regulated expression on complex traits and diseases

finding: Findings indicated a significant association between the CLU gene rs11136000 variant and mild cognitive impairment in patients with T2DM, implicating its role in cognitive aspects related to diabetes.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The variant rs62512616 was identified as significant in both the CompGaming and SCZ GWAS, with p-values of 3.01x10^-8 and 2.30x10^-9, respectively. This variant was found to have opposing effects in SCZ (log10(odds ratio)=0.025) and CompGaming (beta=-0.007), indicating a significant genetic overlap correlated with differently directed phenotypic outcomes.
title: DRD2 and FOXP2 are implicated in the associations between computerized device use and psychiatric disorders

finding: The variant rs4872393 was identified as a lead SNP associated with VATadjBMI and waist-to-hip ratio in a large cohort of 40,032 individuals from the UK Biobank. The study confirmed its association with VATadj, ASATadj, GFATadj, and BMI, particularly in carriers of the minor allele A. The analysis involved comprehensive genetic variation within a 250 kb region around rs4872393, encompassing multiple nominally significant variants related to VATadjBMI.
title: A single cell atlas of human and mouse white adipose tissue

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly associated with Alzheimer’s disease, with a reported p-value of 4.21 × 10^{-8}, suggesting a strong relation to AD pathology.
title: Deep Learning-based Feature Extraction with MRI Data in Neuroimaging Genetics for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs2196315 was found at chr8:130787049 with a p-value of 8.02 × 10^{-8}. It was connected to the ADCY8 gene, suggesting potential links between cognitive function and neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Deep Learning-based Feature Extraction with MRI Data in Neuroimaging Genetics for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs11786030 SNP in AGO2 was associated with the survival of breast cancer patients.
title: A pan-cancer atlas of somatic mutations in miRNA biogenesis genes

finding: The rs2292779 SNP in AGO2 was also associated with the survival of breast cancer patients.
title: A pan-cancer atlas of somatic mutations in miRNA biogenesis genes

finding: SNP rs56800165 showed an association with the gene SNAI2, which is a target of the glucocorticoid receptor. It also extended this association to PTPN6, with a q-value FDR ≤ 0.17, revealing its roles in glucose homeostasis and inflammatory responses in various diseases.
title: Causal Network Inference from Gene Transcriptional Time Series Response to Glucocorticoids

finding: The SNP rs1313432491 was detected by Bayestrat and found to be within a high LD region flanked by two significant eQTLs, indicating that it is a true positive finding. This SNP's significance supports its relevance in the context of genetic studies.
title: Bayestrat: Population Stratification Correction Using Bayesian Shrinkage Prior for Genetic Association Studies

finding: The SNP rs17410962 was previously reported to have a significant association with HDL, and it was detected by Bayestrat. This finding suggests that it plays a crucial role in HDL levels, enhancing the evidence from prior studies.
title: Bayestrat: Population Stratification Correction Using Bayesian Shrinkage Prior for Genetic Association Studies

finding: The SNP rs1400899529 was identified by Bayestrat and is situated between two reported eQTLs. The region encompassing this SNP is within a high LD block, thus providing strong evidence of its significance in relation to lipid metabolism.
title: Bayestrat: Population Stratification Correction Using Bayesian Shrinkage Prior for Genetic Association Studies

finding: The fine-mapped variant rs10283362 was shown to increase enhancer activity in a regulatory element controlling NDRG1 expression. It demonstrated its influence on tubule epithelial regulatory element function, highlighting its significant role in kidney function through the modulation of NDRG1 expression.
title: Variants in tubule epithelial regulatory elements mediate most heritable differences in human kidney function

finding: The SNP rs2572431, located on chromosome 8, was found to be significantly associated with individual differences in anxiety-related coping modes. This finding suggests that variations at this locus may influence behavioral responses to anxiety, thus linking it to certain psychiatric disorders.
title: Similarities and dissimilarities between psychiatric cluster disorders

finding: The study identified rs531564 as one of the SNPs that influenced transcriptional regulation mechanisms associated with miR-124. It was part of a case-control study investigating the relationship between this SNP and persistent high-risk HPV infection, which is a significant risk factor for cervical cancer.
title: Exosomal miRNA-124 is involved in the immune regulation of cervical cancer by regulating CD45 alternative splicing

finding: The SNP rs73662598 was also identified as influencing the transcriptional regulation of miR-124. Similar to rs531564, this SNP was investigated within the context of high-risk HPV persistence and its implications in cervical cancer susceptibility.
title: Exosomal miRNA-124 is involved in the immune regulation of cervical cancer by regulating CD45 alternative splicing

finding: Identified as influencing the miR-124 regulatory mechanisms, rs73246163 was part of the analysis concerning its correlation with persistent high-risk HPV infection, contributing to understanding genetic factors associated with cervical cancer.
title: Exosomal miRNA-124 is involved in the immune regulation of cervical cancer by regulating CD45 alternative splicing

finding: The SNP rs6998061 was associated with colorectal cancer and was noted to exceed the exome-wide significance threshold, with a p-value of 1.4E-07. This finding supported the detection of functional variability linked to colorectal cancer, highlighting a strong association that was consistent with protective or risk gene directionality identified in existing literature.
title: PWAS: Proteome-Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs10099100 was located near the gene PINX1, which showed a marginal association in UTMOST Single Tissue Analysis. It was also noted that the association of a neighboring gene, C8orf74, had been previously identified in the context of ASD, highlighting its relevance in the genetic architecture of this disorder.
title: UTMOST, A Novel Single And Cross-Tissue TWAS (Transcriptome Wide Association Study), Reveals New ASD (Autism Spectrum Disorder) Associated Genes

finding: The rs192456638 variant was associated with T1D risk and mapped to a region implicating TOX gene regulatory mechanisms and their contribution to the disease process.
title: Large-scale genetic association and single cell accessible chromatin mapping defines cell type-specific mechanisms of type 1 diabetes risk

finding: The SNP rs10110433 was identified in a study that linked it to higher levels of the splicing factor BUD31 in ovarian cancer patients. This increased expression of BUD31 was associated with worse prognosis, indicating that SNP rs10110433 may contribute to cancer development through dysregulated splicing of genes such as BCL2L12, which plays a critical role in apoptosis.
title: Splicing factor BUD31 promotes ovarian cancer progression through sustaining the expression of anti-apoptotic BCL2L12

finding: This genetic variant significantly decreased the expression of MRPL15 in the brain-amygdala, brain-hypothalamus, and brain-frontal cortex, with very low p-values indicating a strong association.
title: Unveiling the role of Tdark genes in genetic diseases and phenotypes through bioinformatics-based functional enrichment and network analyses

finding: In the study, the rs6983267 SNP was associated with allelic-specific upregulation of MYC in colon cancer cells. This SNP was implicated in sustaining a higher preferential binding of TCF4 to a distant enhancer element, illustrating the role of this genetic variant in regulating MYC expression through chromatin looping.
title: A novel tool for monitoring endogenous human MYC transcription and translation by EGFP tag insertion at the 3’ end using CRISPR-Cas9 genome editing

finding: The SNP rs7844298 (P746S) in the EDEM3 gene demonstrated a significant association with lower blood triglyceride (TG) levels, showing a 5% decrease (p=1.2X10^-5) in plasma TG among >300,000 individuals. This finding was not associated with HDL-C and LDL-C levels (p>0.05), highlighting its specific influence on TG metabolism.
title: EDEM3 modulates plasma triglyceride level through its regulation of LRP1 expression

finding: The rs2442598 polymorphism in the ANGPT-2 gene was associated with an increased risk of diabetic retinopathy among type 1 diabetes mellitus patients, implicating it in microvascular complications.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The HAS2 gene variant rs2046571 exhibited marginal association with Parkinson's disease in Chinese females, suggesting its potential relevance in gender-specific disease manifestations.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: SNP rs10096097 in GOAT gene was identified in association with type 2 diabetes mellitus in an Egyptian population, indicating its potential role in metabolic disorders.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: This SNP was in the 3'UTR of the PABPC1 gene, known for its crucial role in L1 and Alu transposition modulation, supporting its significance in this regulatory context.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS reveals loci linked to human variation in LINE-1- and Alu-copy numbers

finding: The lead variant rs28834970 was part of the PTK2B locus, showing significant eQTL effects on expression levels in myeloid cell types. The associations indicated that expression levels were normalized based on varying genotype groups, highlighting its relevance to AD risk.
title: A map of transcriptional heterogeneity and regulatory variation in human microglia

finding: The SNP rs10090278 was associated with the targeting of Focal Adhesion Kinase (FAK) in melanoma. This finding indicated that variations at this locus could influence the efficacy of therapies aimed at inhibiting FAK, which is critical in the context of the drug-tolerant subpopulation in minimal residual disease (MRD). The research demonstrated that targeting FAK could delay relapse in patient-derived tumor xenografts, suggesting a significant role for this SNP in therapeutic resistance mechanisms.
title: A neural crest stem cell-like state drives nongenetic resistance to targeted therapy in melanoma

finding: The study referenced the relationship of rs10100348 with inflammation mediated by COX-2/PGE2 in Oral Squamous Cell Carcinoma (OSCC). This SNP was involved in the understanding of ferroptosis drivers in OSCC progression, indicating its potential as a factor in tumorigenesis and therapeutic interventions.
title: Comparison of Ferroptosis Related Genes expression in Human Oral Squamous Cell Carcinoma and Normal oral tissues

finding: At the ANK1 locus, rs148766658 was categorized as a muscle signal, as its credible set SNPs mapped to strong enhancer and transcribed chromatin states in skeletal muscle, indicating a distinct effector role in T2D risk.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The signal rs13262681 at the ANK1 locus colocalized with an eQTL for NKX6.3 expression in pancreatic islets and was categorized as an islet signal due to overlap with a strong islet enhancer.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs10094872 was highlighted for its significant association with pancreatic cancer in the study, reinforcing connections to metabolic syndromes.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population
